Mwanamisi and her husband have five children, two of whom are now grown. Thanks to all of her efforts, her three younger children are pursuing their studies. She says that she never had the opportunity to proceed with her own studies after completing primary level. Therefore, her greatest wish is to see all of her children pursue professional careers so that they can have a better future.

Mwanamisi is requesting a loan that will be used to purchase firewood, wheat, maize flour, and other items of basic necessity so that she can restock her business.

loans.use: to purchase firewood, wheat, maize flour, and other items of basic necessity so that she can restock her business

loans.name: Rodah

texts.en:
Rodah is a farmer. For nine years, she has operated a farm where she raises and sells such vegetables as maize, beans, and kale. She and her husband have two children, ages five and 11 years old. She describes herself as an honest woman. Her business's primary customers are the local residents of her neighborhood. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient water for irrigation. 

Rodah has requested a Kes 21,000 loan. With her loan funds, she will buy a water tank for the purpose of harvesting rain water for family use. 

Her business goal is to make improvements to her farm within the next five years. In the future, she intends to build rental houses to offer for accommodation and also to purchase a lorry to assist in the transportation of produce from the farm.

loans.use: buy a water tank for the purpose of harvesting rain water for family use

loans.name: Fred

texts.en:
Fred, who makes a living by selling fruit and vegetables in a grocery store, is married to a single wife with three children, all of whom are in school. He learned the sales business from a very young age with his mother, and already has over four years of experience with which he has managed to support his family.

He asks for a loan in order to buy more stock of fruit and vegetables. His aspiration is to stabilize the financial situation of his family through increased sales. They live in a rental house that has neither electricity nor piped water.

Fred is a very kind and jovial person as his customers describe him. He is working hard to keep his children moving on with their studies.

loans.use: to buy more fruit and vegetables to stock.

loans.name: Nazlije

texts.en:
Nazlije owns and operates a chicken farm to earn her living. She started her business two years ago with 50 chickens, and she has gradually increased this number since then. She sells eggs and chickens in her community and in the neighboring areas. 

Nazlije's business is the only source of income for her family and she works hard to improve the standard of living for herself and her child. She and her child live in Kosovo in a Roma community.

She is requesting a loan in order to buy chickens. Her business is starting to grow and she has employed a salesperson who helps her with the distribution of the eggs and chickens from her farm throughout the community and the surrounding area.

Nazlije's goal is to have a poultry farm with increasing numbers of chickens and to provide a decent life for her family.

loans.use: to buy chickens

loans.name: Ky's Group

texts.en:
Ky, age 49, lives in a rural area of the Ek Phnom district of Cambodia. She has four children, two of whom are still in her care. She has been involved in rice farming and planting beans for almost 30 years while her husband has been in fishing. She can earn around KHR 50,800 per day from her current business. She spends KHR 39,400 to support her family. Ky’s main challenge is low crop yields from her farming.

Ky’s group consists of two female members. She is leading her group to apply for a first loan with Kiva's partner, VisionFund. As the leader, she will use her portion to buy gasoline for her water pump to carry water into her farmland. She hopes this loan will enable her to increase her crop yields and earn more income to expand her current business.

loans.use: To buy petroleum for her water pump

loans.name: Tanzanite Group

texts.en:
Chongera, who is in his early 50s, is married with four children who are still going to school. He has been a tailor for 10 years now.  He works from 7:30 am to 6:30 pm daily and is able to make a small monthly profit.

This will be his 15th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  He used the previous loans to start building his house, buy materials, and pay school fees and household expenses. He has paid back all his loans successfully.  He wants a loan to buy more materials for dressmaking. His dream is to finish building his house.

Chongera will share this loan with his loan group "Tanzanite", which has a total of 14 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back this loan.

loans.use: to buy more materials for dressmaking.

loans.name: Silas

texts.en:
Silas is a 54-year-old married man. He has 4 children with ages ranging from 3 years to 26 years. He describes himself as a determined man. 

Silas operates a retail shop where he sells timber. He has been involved in this business for 28 years. He describes his biggest business challenge to be the high cost of production of the timber raw material and its scarcity. He will use the KES 59,000 loan to purchase a water tank. His business goal is to be a distributor of timber in his town area within 5 years. He hopes that in the future, he can build rental houses as a result of the profits he is expecting to generate.

loans.use: to buy a water tank.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma, age 40, is a fish vendor. She started her own fish sales business in 2005 in order to provide a source of income to help sustain the needs of her family. She and her husband have a son and a daughter, both of whom study in Form 4.

Thanks to her persistence and hard work, Fatuma has been able to develop her business and now earns a monthly income of 4,000 KES. She buys her fish from fishmongers. Her merchandise selection has been limited until now, which is why she has requested a loan in the amount of 20,000 KES. The expected profits from this loan will be invested into expanding her offerings and improving her business. 

The loan will be used to purchase a stock of fish to be offered for sale.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of fish to be offered for sale

loans.name: Jackson

texts.en:
Jackson has been operating a mobile phone repair and accessories shop in Mariakani, Kenya for the last three years. He employs two other staff in his business. Besides his business, Jackson is a family man, married and with one child. 

He learnt about Milango from other clients who had obtained loans from Milango to improve their businesses. With a loan capital of 52,250 Kenya shillings, he will be able to purchase other repair tools and mobile phone accessories. 

The income obtained from this business will help improve the standard of living of his family and that of his employees. He intends to use the extra income from this loan to open a mobile money transfer shop.

loans.use: To purchase other repair tools and mobile phone accessories.

loans.name: Mwanajuma

texts.en:
Mwanajuma is a resident of Changamwe, Kenya, and sells charcoal. She is a mother of five children, four of whom are in school. In this business, Mwanajuma sells charcoal and firewood. It was started four years ago.
Mwanajuma is applying for a loan of 62,700 Kenyan shillings to purchase additional stocks of charcoal. She has no other source of income and greatly depends on this for her living. The challenges in this new business are customers not paying on time and the high cost of transport, especially for a trader dealing with small amounts of stock, thereby reducing the profit margin.
Mwanajuma aspires to build a family house in the near future and to be a supplier of charcoal to other dealers. She believes her association with Milango and its partners will help her achieve this goal.

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks of charcoal

loans.name: Eliud

texts.en:
Eliud lives in Kongowea, Kenya. He is involved in the transport industry. He has been involved in this business for four years. Besides this, Eliud also sells second-hand clothes.
Eliud was introduced to Milango by his friends and joined to access funding for his business. He is applying for a loan of 41,900 Kenya shillings to purchase vehicle tyres and carry out body work on his vehicle.
His ambitions include buying another vehicle. The challenge in this business has been high fuel costs and high cost of spare parts.
He will use the extra income to purchase fuel and for other operations.

loans.use: To purchase vehicle tyres and carry out body work on his vehicle.

loans.name: Jenny Ines

texts.en:
Inés, age 33, lives in her own house with her two minor children. Inés is a hard working, selfless mother with a strong desire to get ahead. Indeed, she has recently finished repaying a loan to Kiva borrowers earlier than the deadline. That loan helped her to purchase goods she sells ahead of the holiday season to take advantage of increasing demand, and this was a success. A year after, she is looking to continue to implement a similar strategy as the winter comes to Peru.

She lives in an urban, developing community belonging to Chiclayo District. Inés has been a street vendor of women’s clothing for the last eight years. Every Sunday she heads out to the outside of a popular market located half an hour from her house where most of her sales take place. She’s managed to win over a base of regular customers who pay her in cash. 

Inés is asking Edpyme Alternativa for a 3500 soles loan to invest in her business. She wants to take advantage of the change in season and again of the national holidays to increase sales and to renew her stock merchandise. She believes offering winter clothes is the way forward and wants to increase the range of winter clothes offered to her clients. 

Inés is one of this institution’s most faithful clients and she has an excellent credit history. She has always repaid her loans punctually.

loans.use: to buy winter clothes for her business in order to take advantage of this busy season

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is a 40-year-old widow with two children who are 13 and 17 years old, respectively. She also looks after one dependant.

Grace has a nursery and daycare center within the city outskirts, which she started last year to increase her income to meet her family's demands and send her children to school.

She wants UGX 2,000,000 to plaster two rooms that will be used as classrooms. She hopes to add a vocational training centre that will help train students that cannot afford higher education. Her main challenge is the rising cost of items, which leads to a hike in school fees, thereby straining the parents' finances.

Grace is very hard working and honest.

loans.use: To plaster two classrooms

loans.name: Virgilia

texts.en:
Virgilia is a 35-year-old married woman and a mother of three children who are 13, 11 and 7 years old. She has been engaged in a sari-sari store (corner store) business for five years now. 

Virgilia works hard in order to give support to her husband in meeting their financial needs. However, she lacks the funds or the capital to be used for the improvement of her business. At this time, Virgilia is asking for a loan worth 7,000 PHP, which she will use to buy additional merchandise like rice, noodles, canned goods and snack food. 

Virgilia believes that if she will be provided with financial support through this loan, she can finally be able to purchase the necessary stock for her business. 

In the future, Virgilia believes that through this opportunity, she can improve and expand the range and scale of her business, which would eventually give her a larger amount of income. And she hopes that she can continually send her children to school so that they will be able to gain a higher level of learning for a brighter future.

loans.use: to buy additional merchandise like rice, noodles, canned goods and snack food

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase additional stock of sand, ballast and building stones, etc.

loans.name: Malkia Group

texts.en:
Radhia, who is in her early 30s, is married with two children who go to school. She has been selling sarongs, fabrics and materials for two years now. She works from 8.00 am to 8.00 pm daily and is able to make good monthly profit.

This will be her 1st loan from Tujijenge Tanzania which she wants to use for buying  more materials, fabrics and sarongs to resell. Her dream is to one day be able to sell her products at wholesale prices.

Radhia will share this loan with her loan group "Malkia" which has a total of 15 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy more materials, fabrics and sarongs to resell.

loans.name: Level One Group

texts.en:
Matha, who is in her middle 50s, is married with four grown-up children. She has been running a charcoal business for two years now.  She works from 7.00 am to 6.00 pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be her 1st loan from Tujijenge Tanzania which she wants to use for buying more sacks of charcoal and to start selling new clothes. Her dream is to one day be an international businesswoman.

Matha will share this loan with her loan group "Level One" which has a total of 12 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of charcoal and start selling new clothes.

loans.name: Mwanasha

texts.en:
Mwanasha is a resident of Malindi, Kenya. She owns a cafe which has been in operation for six years. Out of this business, Mwanasha has been able to support her family: a husband and two children, one of whom is in school. In this café she sells meat, fish, and cooked cereals.
The number of customers visiting her business has increased, putting pressure on her existing facilities. 
The main aim of this loan of 21,050 Kenya shillings is to buy cooking fat, flour, cereals etc. She believes that she will then be able to put more focus into her business. Mwanasha’s desire is to have a clothes shop.

loans.use: to buy cooking fat, flour, cereals etc. for her cafe

loans.name: Erica Deysi

texts.en: Erica is 33 and lives in a house with her husband and children. The house has electricity, but no other services. It is in a rural part of Tambogrande, a district in Northern Peru. Erica is a hard working micro-entrepreneur. On the one hand, she raises chickens in a yard behind her house, a business she has operated for a number of years. This was the focus of the loan which she has just finished paying responsibly to Kiva lenders. Yet, lately she has also developed a small shop, where she sells clothes and cosmetics and this has proven to have been a very good business idea. Indeed, it is precisely as a result of the increasing demand for her products that she is applying to Edpyme Alternativa for a 1,000 soles loan. She felt the good rates offered and the success of her first loan are a good reason to try to continue consolidating this activity. Erica is looking to buy seasonal clothes and cosmetics to sell in her shop. She works hard and has good references, both personal and work-related, from people in the area. Her goal is to provide a good education for her children.

loans.use: to buy seasonal merchandise for her shop, in particular winter clothes and cosmetics

loans.name: Maria

texts.en: Maria is 69 years old and lives with her husband. They live in Northern Peru in a small rural community of around 150 families; they have electricity but no water services. Maria has set up a small shop in her own house, where she sells drinks and snacks. This shop has proven a success and she has developed a good reputation in the community, as her shop provides important supplies for the rest of the inhabitants. Moreover, she raises and commercializes animals, which she also has at the back of her humble house. As a result of the success of her shop and the strong demand for animals, she is looking for a loan of 2000 soles to invest in both of her businesses. In particular, she is looking to increase the stock of beer, which has proven very popular in her shop, as well as buying animals and animal feed. She feels this is the right strategic move and will help her to improve her family's living condition.

loans.use: to increase the stock of beer, which has proven very popular in her humble shop, as well as buying animals and animal feed.

loans.name: Jenneth

texts.en:
Jenneth, age 37, operates a market stall business where she sells vegetables, dried fish, and eggs in the community market. She buys quantities of vegetables and dried fish and sells these per kilo. Her regular customers are her neighbors and members of the local community. She earns a minimum of Php1000 in sales every day.

Jenneth lives in Manila with her husband Jose and their two children. Jenneth and her husband manage their own household while operating the business. 

Jenneth is working hard to continually provide income for the family's everyday expenses. To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PhP 40,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy larger quantities of dried fish, eggs, and vegetables so as to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she invests in this expansion.

Jenneth hopes to be able to expand her business in the near future and eventually to have her own house for the family to live in. She hopes to support her children's schooling up to the college level. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay micro finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional stocks of supplies and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Siblina

texts.en:
Siblina is 38 years old and lives in the town of Likoni in the Mombasa south region of Kenya. She is married and has five children, four of whom are currently in school while the fifth is grown up and married. 

For the past four years, Siblina has been working hard to manage a clothing-sales business. Siblina has requested a loan of KES 40,000 from Yehu. The loan will be used to expand the business, and will help Siblina to generate greater profits and to increase her capital. She hopes that in the future she will be able to open up a bigger shop. 

Thanks for this opportunity given to her, as she says that it will help her to purchase bundles of clothes for sale. Other sources of income include earnings from her husband, who Siblina describes as a responsible man who really cares for her.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of clothes for sale.

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena, age 50, earns her living by preparing and selling a variety of snacks. She has operated this business for 10 years. Elena and her husband have two children. She lives in Upper Puntod, Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental.

Elena has been a member of PMPC for six years. She has requested a loan of 20,000 to purchase flour, sugar, milk, and other necessary ingredients for the snack items she offers for sale.

In the future, Elena hopes to increase her savings and improve her available business capital.

loans.use: to purchase fflour, sugar, milk, and cooking oil

location.town: Plaridel-Upper Puntod, Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occide

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma is married with three children. She is 42 years old and lives in Mamanga Daku, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental.

Vilma sells assorted groceries in a general store to earn a living and has had this business for 10 years. Each month, she earns PHP 5,000 doing this type of work. She has requested a loan for 10,000 PHP to purchase assorted goods like sacks of sugar and salt, soft drinks and sardines.

Vilma has been a member of PMPC for  10 months.  In the future, Vilma hope to save for family use.

loans.use: To purchase assorted goods like sacks of sugar and salt, soft drinks and sardines

loans.name: Modesta

texts.en:
Modesta is 50 years old and lives in Calunasan, Larena, Siquijor. She is married with four school-aged children.

Modesta has a grocery store business to earn a living and has had this business for three years. She requested a  loan of 7000 PHP to purchase assorted canned goods and other grocery items.

Modesta has been a member of Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative for almost two years.  In the future, Modesta hopes to grow her business and able to allocate savings in preparation for the college education of her children.

loans.use: To purchase assorted canned goods  and other grocery items

loans.name: Je-Ann

texts.en:
Je-ann works hard to support three children. She is married and has a pig fattening business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 1500 loan through NWTF to buy a SOLAR LAMP.

She is getting the solar lamp because she wants to have backup light in case of emergency.

Je-ann is aware that by using the solar lamp, she is not only saving money, she is also helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: to buy a solar lamp.

loans.name: Mandakh's Buleg Group

texts.en:
Mandakh is a 56-year-old married woman who has two children, who are 23 and 27 years old. Her family lives in their own 'ger', a traditional Mongolian felt tent, which is located in the outer 'ger' district of Ulaanbaatar city, Mongolia. 

Mandakh has been supporting her family by operating a felt manufacturing business since 2004. She usually sews felt sandals and souvenirs and sells them at a local indoor market. During the summer time there are many tourists in Mongolia and they are really overjoyed to buy traditional felt souvenirs and sandals. 

Mandakh wants to expand her business in order to increase her working capital during the tourist season in Mongolia. So she is requesting a 1,000,000 MNT (Mongolian Tugriks) loan to purchase raw materials to make more products.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials to make felt products

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a freezer, display shelves and a double booth unit

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en: Jocelyn is 35 years old and a mother to four children ages 3, 9, 10 and 15. She has been engaged in the cell phone credit-reloading business for two years now. Prepaid reloading is very easy because she does not have to be away from her children just to earn an income. She is asking for a loan to buy prepaid loads, clothes and food. Once she has enough loads to resell, she can be assured of a better income. Her customers don't have to go to her competitors. Her profit will enable her to buy decent clothing for her children as well as nutritious food for them. She hopes to have another business someday, so she can support their education too.

loans.use: to buy prepaid loads for cell phones, clothes and food

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
Marissa, age 43, earns an income by preparing and selling homemade snack items. She and her husnamd have three children and live in Polangyuta, Siquijor. Marissa earns about PhP 2,000.00 each month running her business.  

Marissa has requested a loan in the amount of PhP 3,000 in order to purchase flour, milk, baking materials, and other ingredients needed for the preparation of the snacks she sells. 

Marissa is a newly-recognized member of Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative. In the future, Marissa hopes to sustain her small business so that she can provide for the daily needs and school expenses of her children.

loans.use: to purchase flour, milk, baking materials, and other ingredients needed for the preparation and sale of her homemade snacks

loans.name: Eng

texts.en:
Eng is 55 years old and a hard-working woman who is responsible for four children, residing with her family in Baray district of Kompong Tom province. She is a local farmer and has been working in this type of business for ages, earning in the neighborhood of USD 5.00 per day. In this coming rainy season, Eng will devote most of her time to working at her rice field. Eng’s husband gives her full support in this business, and aside from this, he grows lotus fruits for additional income.

Eng and her husband are finding ways to improve their current businesses. They want to expand their land for farming and thereby increase the household income. Consequently, Eng would like to take out a loan of USD 400 to purchase an extra plot of land for growing lotus fruits. She hopes to further improve her business through the loan. Eng will use her increased income to support her children’s educations.

loans.use: to buy an extra plot of land for growing lotus fruit.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa works hard to support her family. She is married and has a  sugarcane farming business in the Philippines.

Elsa is borrowing PHP 1500  through NWTF to buy a SOLAR LAMP.

She is getting the solar lamp because she wants to have backup light in case of emergency.

Elsa is aware that by using the solar lamp, she is saving money, she is helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: to buy a solar lamp.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan, age 44, runs a general store to earn an income. She has been in this business for 12 years and sells a variety of items such as soap, shampoo, canned goods, eggs, and spices. She and her husband have five children. With two children currently going to school, Susan works very hard to provide for them.

Susan has requested a PhP 15,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase additional stocks of merchandise to sell in her store.

In the future, Susan would like to save enough money to expand her business and to offer her children a college education.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of merchandise to sell in her store

loans.name: Lucresia

texts.en: Lucresia is 57 years old from Sikatuna, Bohol. She is married with four grown children. She is currently engaged in raising hogs for an income. She enjoys taking care of her hogs while she is also dreaming that she can provide a bigger income for her family. Although her children can look after themselves, Lucresia hopes that she can be independent and earn for her own needs. She is asking for a loan to buy feed, piglets and supplements for her hog-raising business. This will guarantee that her hogs will be healthy and easy to market in four months time. Her income will be for her family's healthy diet, savings for old age and reinvestment in the same business.

loans.use: to buy feed, piglets and supplements

loans.name: Nicolasa

texts.en:
Nicolasa, age 53, runs a store where she sells such items as soft drinks, cooking oil, bread, biscuits, and candies. She has run her business for four years. She and her husband have five children. She lives in Lower Toril, Aloran, Misamis Occidental. 

Nicolasa has a requested a loan in the amount of PhP 10,000 in order to buy additional inventory of merchandise to offer for sale in her store. She has been a member of PMPC for eight years.  

In the future, Nicolasa hopes to own a house and lot.

loans.use: to buy additional inventory of merchandise to offer for sale

loans.name: Unda

texts.en:
Unda is 26 years old and lives in the town of Likoni in the coastal region of Kenya. Thanks to Yehu and Kiva for their support from the first loan.

To help expand his business, he has requested another loan of KES 50,000 to purchase leather and beads. Unda sells his shoes mostly to tourists from abroad. The loan will help him to generate greater profits and increase his inventory. He hopes that in the future he will be able to use loan profits to expand and start a new business. 

He says that he is working very hard to support his parents and also pay school fees for his siblings.

loans.use: to purchase leather and beads

loans.name: Robinson Dick

texts.es:
Robinson es un joven de 26 años de edad, vive al lado de su pareja en la linda y maravillosa ciudad de Pucallpa, ciudad que se caracteriza por tener un clima cálido y acogedor, asimismo se ubica en la selva peruana y posee una flora y fauna impresionante, en una ciudad en la cual uno puede desconectarse del bullicio de la ciudad y apreciar lo maravilloso de la naturaleza ya que sus paisajes son lindísimos. En su tiempo libre a Robinson le gusta mucho pasear con su pareja y sobre todo comer juntos uno de los platillos que más le gusta a Robinson  el riquísimo “Arroz con mariscos”. Debido a los pocos recursos económicos de sus padres el solo pudo estudiar hasta el quinto grado de secundaria, pero le hubiera gustado estudiar mecánica automotriz.

Con mucho entusiasmo Robinson trabaja en su negocio como chofer de mototaxi, el trabaja alrededor de 10 horas al día y puede atender hasta 40 clientes en el día, es su sustento de trabajo y sobre todo con el cual puede solventar los gastos de su hogar junto a su esposa quien trabaja en una tienda de venta de llantas; el cree que le va bien en su negocio porque es muy amable con los clientes y sus tarifas en el trasporte son muy cómodas. 

Robinson está muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva ay que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá realizar mejoras en su vivienda ya que comprara materiales como calaminas, clavos, madera para poder refaccionar las partes deterioradas por las lluvias , así de esta manera el podrá mejorar su calidad de vida y podrá seguir trabajando y luchando para hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Tener un negocio propio un taller de mecánica”.
texts.en:
Robinson is a young man 26 years old, who lives with his partner in the beautiful and marvellous city of Pucallpa, a city which is characterized by its warm and welcoming climate.  It is located in the Peruvian jungle and has an impressive flora and fauna.  It is a city where one can disconnect from the hustle and bustle of the city and appreciate the marvels of nature, as its landscapes are very beautiful. In his free time Robinson really likes going for walks with his partner and above all eating together.  One of his favorite dishes is the delicious "rice with seafood".  Due to the scarce economic resources of his parents he was only able to study as far as the fifth grade of secondary school, but he would have liked to study automotive mechanics.

Robinson works with great enthusiasm in his job as a mototaxi driver.  He works about 10 hours a day and can serve up to 40 clients per day.  This is how he earns a living and above all how he pays the bills in his household, together with his spouse who works in a tire store.  He believes that his business is doing well because he is very friendly with his clients, and his fares for transportation are very reasonable.

Robinson is very grateful to the Kiva lenders because thanks to the help they are providing him he will be able to make improvements to his house, as he will buy materials such as corrugated iron, nails and wood to repair parts which have deteriorated due to rain.  In this way he can improve his quality of life and can continue working and fighting to achieve his greatest dream:  to have his own automotive repair business.

loans.use: to improve his house.

loans.name: Nurbukan

texts.ru:
Нурбукан 39 лет, замужем, воспитывает 3 детей. Нурбукан работает преподавателем в местной школе и в качестве дополнительного источника дохода для своей семьи, Нурбукан занимается заготовкой и реализацией  сельхозпродукции. Начав этот бизнес в 1998 году с суммы в 10,000 сом (KGS), на сегодняшний  день  хозяйстве Нурбукан имеется 1 корова, 3,5 га орошаемой земли, где она выращивает фасоль и многолетние травы.  Выручка с продажи молока и молочных продуктов составляет 4,000 сом в месяц. 
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Нурбукан обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS)  на покупку семян, минеральных удобрений и ГСМ.  Доходы от кредита Нурбукан планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение хозяйства.
texts.en:
Nurbukan is 39 years old, married, and bringing up three children. Nurbukan works as a teacher at a local school. As an additional source of income for her family, Nurbukan grows farm produce for sale. She has launched this business in 1998 with a starting capital of 10,000 KGS. At present, Nurbukan’s farm includes one cow as well as 3.5 ha [about 9 acres] of arable land, where she grows beans and perennial herbs. Her income from selling milk and dairy products is about 4,000 KGS.

In order to develop her business further, Nurbukan turned to “Bai Tushum & Partners” for a loan in the amount of 50,000 KGS to buy seeds, mineral fertilizers and fuel. Nurbukan plans to reinvest the resulting income into a further business growth.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers and fuel.

loans.name: Severa

texts.en:
Severa is a 41-year-old married woman and a resident in Panglao, Bohol, Philippines. She has three children: one girl and two boys ages 7, 5 and 3. She has been in the poultry business together with her husband for more than a year now. Currently, their business is working fine.

At this time, Severa is asking for a loan for additional budget for her house renovation since it requires a larger amount of materials. She will use the loan to buy materials such as cement, wood and nails.

Severa is determined that an ambient home is necessary for the family and that it will give them shelter and protection.

loans.use: to buy materials for house renovation such as cement, wood, nails, etc.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace works hard to support 7 children. She is married and has a clothing sales business in the Philippines.

Grace requested a PHP 1500 loan through NWTF to buy a solar lamp.

She is getting the solar lamp because she wants to save money by minimizing her kerosene expenses.

Grace is aware that by using the solar lamp, she is not only saving money, she is also helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: to buy a solar lamp.

loans.name: Colina

texts.en:
As a married parent of 3 children, Colina works hard to support her family.

She has a business buying and selling bananas in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending.  Colina is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to purchase more bananas to sell for her business.

Colina has been sustaining her business activities through her past 19 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to repair and renovate her store.

loans.use: To purchase more bananas to sell

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda is 34 years old and married with 2 children.

She earns a living by raising livestock in the Philippines. Rosalinda is borrowing PHP 24,500 through NWTF to purchase more livestock to raise.

Rosalinda has been raising livestock for 9 years and also earns additional income from selling fresh milk.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to purchase more livestock to raise

loans.name: Adita Paquita

texts.es:
Adita es una mujer muy jovial y entusiasta, tiene 35 años de edad, vive al lado de pareja, juntos tienen 2 hijos cuyas edades comprenden 12 y 05 años y por quienes se esfuerza mucho por darle una vida digna y sobre todo con amor y honradez. Su vivienda se ubica en la ciudad de Pucallpa, ciudad que se caracteriza por tener un clima cálido y acogedor, asimismo se ubica en la selva peruana y posee una flora y fauna impresionante, en una ciudad en la cual uno puede desconectarse del bullicio de la ciudad y apreciar lo maravilloso de la naturaleza ya que sus paisajes son lindísimos. En su tiempo libre a Adita le gusta mucho pasear con su familia sobre todo para compartir con ellos momento d unión, en ocasiones le gusta comer junto a su esposo e hijos uno de sus platillos favoritos el cual es el riquísimo “tallarín con pollo” Ella solo tuvo estudios secundarios, pero le hubiera gustado estudiar corte y confección.

Con mucho cariño y sobre todo entusiasmo Adita trabaja en su negocio de venta de comidas típicas de su ciudad como el riquísimo Juane, el ubachado, entre otros, ella trabaja alrededor de 6 horas al día y puede atender hasta 60 clientes en el día; ella cree que le va bien en su negocio porque tiene muy buena sazón y sobre todo porque cuando prepara sus comidas lo hace con cariño y atiende de manera amable a los clientes.

Adita está muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá  comprar materiales como cemento, calaminas, clavos, mesas, sillas, para realizar un mejoramiento de su local de venta de comida, con esta mejora el podrá brindar un mejor también para los clientes y sobre todo más comodidad, lo que le permitirá mejorar sus ingresos y sobre todo seguir trabajando y luchando cada día para hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Darle una buena profesión a sus hijos y tener un gran restaurante”.
texts.en:
Adita is a very jovial and enthusiastic woman.  She is 35 years old and lives with her partner together with their 2 children, who are 12 and 5 years old, and for whom they work very hard to create a decent, loving and honest life.  Their house is located in the city of Pucallpa, a city characterized by its warm and welcoming climate.  The city is located in the Peruvian jungle and possesses an impressive flora and fauna.  It is a city where one can disconnect from the hustle and bustle of the city and appreciate the marvels of nature, as its landscapes are very beautiful.  In her free time Adita really likes to go for walks with her family, above all in order to spend time with them.  Sometimes she likes to eat her favorite dish with her spouse and children:  the delicious "noodles with chicken".  She only completed secondary school, but would have liked to study dressmaking.

With great affection and above all enthusiasm Adita works in ger business selling food typical of her city such as the delicious "juanes" [a rice and chicken dish], and "ubachado" [a drink], among others.  She works about 6 hours a day and can serve up to 60 clients per day.  She believes that her business is doing well because her food has great taste and above all because when she prepares the food she does it with love and serves her customers in a friendly manner.

Adita is very grateful to the Kiva lenders, as due to their help she will buy materials such as cement, corrugated iron, nails, tables and chairs to improve her food sales premises .  With this improvement she will be able to provide better and more comfortable service to her customers, which will allow her to increase her income and above all to continue working and fighting every day to make her greatest dream a reality:  to provide a good profession to her children and to have a great restaurant.

loans.use: to buy cement, corrugated iron, nails, tables and chairs to improve her business premises.

loans.name: Lateefa

texts.en:
Lateefa is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her husband appears in her Kiva profile photo, pictured in the grocery store.

Lateefa is a 38-year-old woman, she is married and a mother to four sons and two daughters.

Lateefa's husband has had a grocery store for three years, selling different types of groceries. It has been a profitable project and is the only source of income to the family, but not enough to cover their expenses.

Lateefa is requesting a 1,500 USD loan from FATEN to help her husband cover the costs of purchasing basic groceries that customers often request such as rice, sugar and  milk, and to make improvements in the store's condition such as painting and installing additional shelves. This will increase sales and increase the family's income.

loans.use: To purchase a variety of groceries to resell

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is 40 years old and married with 1 kid.

Helen is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Helen requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and medicines for her pigs.

Helen has been raising pigs for 3 years now, and has borrowed 4 times in the past from NWTF and more recently, from Kiva to sustain her business.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is 30 years old and married with 2 children.

Janet works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell in her store.

Janet has been in this business for 6 years and has previously received funds through Kiva.

Janet aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell in her store.

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith is 58 years old and has a common-law husband, Lloyd, with 4 children.

Judith works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 24,000 loan through NWTF to purchase assorted groceries to sell to customers.

Judith has borrowed and paid 11 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 7 years and also earns an income from rug making.

Judith aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase assorted groceries to sell to customers.

loans.name: Novie

texts.en:
This is Novie. She previously accessed an 12,000 PHP loan that she used to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her income as she expands her business. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her child and in their personal, household and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another 15,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and the educational expenses of her child. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Novie hopes to be able to expand soon, just as she dreams of being able to give her family a good future through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from her studies of the Word of God.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To buy grocery items and products for her store.

loans.name: Evelinda

texts.en:
Evelinda works hard to support her family. She is married and has a firewood retail business in the Philippines.

Evelinda requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy firewood to sell.

She has been in this business for 3 years.

In the future, Evelinda would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more firewood to sell.

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
Marivic works hard to support 2 children. She is married and has a business selling vegetables in the Philippines.

Marivic requested a PHP 1500 loan through NWTF to buy a solar lamp.

She is getting the solar lamp because she wants to have a good light source that is waterproof during the rainy season.

Marivic is aware that by using the solar lamp, she is not only saving money, but she is also helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: to buy a solar lamp.

loans.name: Evarista

texts.en:
Evarista is 46 years old and married with 2 children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Evarista runs a sari-sari (general) store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more goods to sell in her store.

Evarista has been in this business for 5 years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, soap, snack foods and other groceries. 

In the future Evarista would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more goods to sell in her store.

loans.name: Lilibeth

texts.en:
Lilibeth is 50 years old and has 3 children with common-law husband Gilbert.

She earns a living by raising livestock in the Philippines. Lilibeth is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

Lilibeth has been raising livestock for 6 years and also earns additional income from selling purified drinking water.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

loans.name: Faustino

texts.en:
Faustino is a 37-year old seaweed farmer living in Bohol, Philippines. He has been in the seaweed farming for about 10 years now. 

Seaweeds known as Eucheuma, a red alga, are endemic to Philippine marine waters. Eucheuma has been dubbed the 20th century wonder plant. It is so called because of its many important uses in various industries. From this seaweed is extracted carrageenan, a valuable substance used in products that need gelling, suspending, thickening, emulsifying and water-holding properties.

He is asking for a loan worth 6,000PHP which he will use to buy materials for seaweed farming such as seedlings, rope and nets.

Faustino works hard to support his wife and their four children, aged 16, 10, 9 and six years old. 

In the future, Faustino hopes to further improve his business and maybe invest in a more lucrative venture. In addition, he aims to continually send his four children to school for better education and learning. He wants to put some of his income into savings for future use.

loans.use: to buy materials for seaweed farming such as seedlings, rope and nets

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda is a 32-year-old resident of Bohol, Philippines. She has been in seaweed farming and fishing for 3 years now, together with her husband and six children ages 12, 8, 7, 6, 2 and 1. She is asking for a loan worth 5000 PHP which she plans to use to buy additional materials for seaweed farming such as seaweed seedlings, rope and nets.

Imelda works hard to support her family, especially the children who are still in school.

In the near future, Imelda hopes to expand her business and maybe engage in larger scale seaweed farming. She wants to earn more in order to help her husband provide for the needs of the family, such as daily consumption, school fees and other expenses.

loans.use: to buy additional materials for seaweed farming such as seaweed seedlings, rope and nets.

loans.name: Prak

texts.en:
Prak decided to involve herself in hog-raising as the main business of her family. She raises piglets and pigs for both slaughter and offspring. From this business, she can send her two children to school and buy her daily food. She has been engaged in this for two years. Her husband shares their responsibilities by trading firewood.

To improve her hog-raising business, Prak is now asking for additional capital in the amount of KHR 2,000,000 to purchase 10 heads of pig and feeds and to expand her pigpen. She mentioned this loan will enable her to handle her business very well. She hopes to gain a good income in the following months, after selling her mature pigs.

loans.use: to purchase 10 heads of pig and feeds and to expand her pigpen.

loans.name: Jonnalyn

texts.en:
This is Jonnalyn, a 33-year-old resident of Bacoor, Cavite, Philippines. She is married, and she is the mother of one child who is not yet of school age. She and her husband are working hard to sustain their family’s everyday expenses.

Jonnalyn operates an electronic cellular phone loading station. What she basically does is to buy electronic cellular phone load credits in huge amounts then retail them for how much the customer is paying. Profit is generated depending on the networks' policy of dealership. She may buy 3,000 Philippines pesos (Php) worth of load for Php2,500, where she already has a Php500 profit, depending on promos and quotas set by the networks.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php20,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy cellular phone load credits from different local networks. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Jonnalyn dreams to be able to send her child to school and to secure her child’s education in the future. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for cellular phone load credits needed in her business.

loans.name: Maria Liza

texts.en:
Maria Liza is 43 years old and married with 7 children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Maria Liza is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy feed and medicines for her pigs.

Maria Liza has been raising pigs for 4 years and earns additional income from abaca weaving.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and medicines for her pigs.

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma is 36 years old and married with 5 children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Norma is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

Norma has been raising pigs for 10 years and also earns additional income from raffia making.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

loans.name: Tseveen Group

texts.en: Tseveensuren is a 48-year-old married woman who lives with her 23-year-old son and her spouse in the outer ger (Mongolian housing tents) district of Ulaanbaatar city, Mongolia. Tseveensuren supports her family by operating a business selling felt products. She usually makes stitched felt rugs and sandals. Also, she made the biggest Mongolian stitched felt rug and is proud of herself. During the summertime, there are so many tourists in Mongolia, and they are really overjoyed to buy traditional felt souvenirs and sandals. She wants to expand her business in order to increase her working capital during the tourist season in Mongolia. Thus, she is requesting a 1,000,000 Mongolian tugriks (MNT) loan to purchase more felt to make felt products. She is a group leader, and she has her hand up in the picture.

loans.use: to purchase more felt to make products.

loans.name: Sras

texts.en:
Sras (in the photo), age 32, is a construction worker. His wife, Sokny, age 33, is a garment worker. They have been married since 2002 and have one daughter, who attends primary school, and one young son. They live in a suburb of Phnom Penh.  

Sras is applying for his first loan in the amount of $1,500 to buy a motorbike for commuting to work.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for commuting to work.

loans.name: Kyry

texts.en:
Kyry (in the photo), age 38, is a teacher. Her husband, Chanra, age 48, is a rice farmer. She has been teaching since 1992 and has five children. One is still young and others attend university, high school and primary school. Kyry also has her elderly mother living with her in a suburb of Phnom Penh.  

Kyry is applying for her first loan in the amount of $400 to assist in her husband’s rice farming by buying fertilizer and pesticide.

loans.use: To assist in her husband’s rice farming by buying fertilizer and pesticide.

loans.name: Changly

texts.en:
Changly (in the photo) is a lathe operator. His wife, Srey Aun, is a garment worker. They live in a suburb of Phnom Penh. They have been married since 1994 and have three children who are all in school. 

Changly is requesting a loan of $500 to build a restroom for his family to use. Because his family relieves themselves in the nearby forest rice field, it’s not clean, convenient or safe for his family. Sometimes, they use their neighbor’s bathroom at night.
 
Because of the restroom that Changly will build, the health of his family members will be better than before.

loans.use: To build a restroom for his family to use.

loans.name: Nery

texts.es:
Nery tiene 47 años de edad, es madre de  2 hijos cuyas edades comprenden 20 y 16 años  a quienes saca adelante sola ya que el padre de sus hijos se separo de ella y desde entonces se convirtió en madre y padre para ellos. Su vivienda se ubica en la ciudad de Ica, ciudad que se caracteriza por tener un clima cálido y acogedor, asimismo se desarrolla la agricultura en especial el cultivo de algodón, paprika, uva, esparrago, paprika, entre otros. Cuando Nery tiene un tiempo libre le gusta mucho cocinar y sobre todo preparar uno de sus platillos favoritos el cual es el riquísimo “Arroz con pato”. Debido a los pocos recursos económicos de sus padres ella solo tuvo estudios secundarios pero le hubiera gustado estudiar para ser profesora.

Con entusiasmo y sobre todo las ganas de salir adelante Nery trabaja en su negocio de venta de comida, ella vende choclo y papa sancochada con queso, ella trabaja alrededor de 7horas al dia y puede atender hasta 20 clientes en el día; ella cree que le va bien en su negocio porque es limpia y ordenada y sobre todo porque sus productos son ricos.

Nery está muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá comprar un carrito mostrador para vender desayunos, con esta mejorar ella podrá ofrecer mayor variedad de productos y mejorara sus ingresos, así de esta manera ella seguirá trabajando y podrá mejorar su calidad de vida además seguirá luchando para hacer realidad su mas grande sueño:” Tener un local propio para vender sus productos y darle una buena educación a sus hijos”.
texts.en:
Nery is 47 years old. She is the mother of 2 children who are 20 and 16 years old. She provides for them alone because her children’s father separated from her and she became a single mother. Her house is located in the city of Ica, a city that is known for having a warm climate and for being friendly. There is a lot of agriculture there, especially the cultivation of cotton, paprika, grapes, and asparagus, among other things. When Nery has free time, she likes to cook and above all she likes to make one of her favorite foods, which is rice with duck. Due to her parents’ humble economic situation, she only went through secondary school, but she would have liked to have studied to become a teacher. 

With enthusiasm, and above all with the desire to get ahead, Nery works in her business selling food. She sells corn and potato stew with cheese. She works around 7 hours per day and can tend to 20 customers in a day. She believes things are going well for her business because it is clean and orderly and  above all because the products are delicious.

Nery is very grateful to the Kiva lenders because it is thanks to the help they have provided her that she will be able to buy a display cart to sell breakfasts. With this improvement she will offer a greater variety of products and will improve her income. In this way she will continue working and will be able to improve her quality of life. She will also continue working to make her biggest dream into a reality: To have her own place where she can sell her products and also provide a good education to her children.

loans.use: to buy a display card for selling breakfasts

loans.name: Jenen

texts.en:
Jenen is a 37-year-old married woman and a mother of 10 children from Bien Unido, Bohol, Philippines. She has been in a fishing business for almost eight years. She is asking for a loan worth 8,000 Philippines pesos (PHP), which she will use to buy additional fishnets and pay for fishing boat maintenance. 

Jenen puts her time in supporting her husband for their fishing business. In the future, Jenen wants to expand their fishing business in order to increase their income, thus giving her a greater opportunity to send her children to school and to meet their daily needs such as food, clothing and shelter. Any additional income will be used for reinvestment and for savings purposes for future use.

loans.use: to buy additional fishnets and pay for fishing boat maintenance.

loans.name: Raul

texts.es:
Raul tiene 20 años de edad, vive en la ciudad de Ica, ciudad que se caracteriza por tener un clima cálido y acogedor, asimismo se desarrolla la agricultura en especial el cultivo de algodón, paprika, uva, esparrago, paprika, entre otros. Cuando dispone de un tiempo libre le gusta mucho jugar futbol con sus amigos, asimismo en ocasiones le gusta comer uno de sus platillos favoritos el cual es el riquísimo “arroz chaufa”. El solo tuvo estudios secundarios, pero le hubiera gustado mucho ser Policía.

Con mucho entusiasmo Raul trabaja como chofer de taxi, ya que como muchos peruano le ha sido difícil conseguir trabajo y su vehículo es su única herramienta para poder solventarse, el trabaja alrededor de 8 hora diarias y puede atender hasta 15 clientes diariamente; el cree que le va bien en su negocio porque da un buen trato a sus cliente y sobre todo es muy responsable cuando conduce.

Raul está muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el poda obtener su permiso de circulación y poder tramitar su licencia de conducir, con esta mejorar evitara que lo infracciones y sobre todo podrá trabajar con mayor tranquilidad y dará mas seguridad a sus clientes, así el podrá seguir trabajando y luchando cada día para hacer realidad su mas grande sueño:” Mejorar su calidad de vida”.
texts.en:
Raul is 20 years old. He lives in the city of Ica, which is known for having a warm climate and being friendly. There is also a lot of agriculture, especially the cultivation of cotton, paprika, grapes, and asparagus, among other things. When he has free time, he very much likes to play soccer with his friends. Sometimes he also likes to eat one of his favorite foods, which is the delicious Peruvian Chinese fried rice. He only finished secondary school, but he would have liked to have been a police man. 

With much enthusiasm, Raul works as a taxi driver. As for many Peruvians, it has been difficult for him to find a job, and his car is his only tool for making a living. He works around 8 hours a day and can tend to 15 customers per day. He thinks things are going well in his business because he treats his customers well, and above all, he is very responsible when he drives. 

Raul is very grateful to the Kiva lenders because it is thanks to the help they have provided that he will be able to get a taxi permit and also go through the process of getting his driver’s license. With this improvement he will be able to avoid traffic infractions and, above all, he will be able to work more calmly and he will provide better safety for his customers. In this way, he will continue working every day to make his biggest dream come true: To improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to go through the process for getting his driver's license

loans.name: Sal

texts.en:
Sal (in the photo), age 55, lives in a village about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh City. She is widowed with three married children: two live separately, and another one still lives in the family's home. 

Sal is a rice farmer. She is applying for a loan in the amount of $1,000 to buy seeds, fertilizer and pesticide to maintain her rice farm. She will also use a part of the loan to build a restroom for her family to use.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer and pesticide to maintain her rice farm, and to build a restroom for her family's use.

loans.name: Saroeun

texts.en:
Saroeun (in the photo), age 55, sells grocery items, meat, and vegetables. Her husband, Phea, age 53, is a rice farmer. Saroeun wants to expand her business, so she decided to request her first loan in the amount of $1,000. She will buy more grocery items, meat, and vegetables for resale. 

Saroeun and her husband live in a suburb of Phnom Penh. They have seven children: three sons and four daughters. Two are married, two are garment workers, one is a soldier, one has full-time employment, and another attends school.

loans.use: to expand her business by buying more grocery items, meat, and vegetables for resale.

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en:
This is Milagros, 53, a resident of Bacoor, Cavite, in the Philippines. She is married to Nelson and is the mother of three children, all of whom are already working. By the grace of God, Milagros has managed to support her children's schooling. At this time, she is working hard to be able to sustain her family's needs for everyday expenses.

Milagros maintains a direct selling business. She sells clothing, footwear, undergarments, cosmetics and other products through popular direct selling brands like Avon, Fullerlife, Natasha, Boardwalk and Marikina Shoe Exchange. A customer's order is bought in cash by the dealer and then given to the customer with a one-month-to-pay credit. Dealer's prices are lower than those in the catalogue, and these are the profits that dealers invest in as their income. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 200 PHP in sales every day.

To help her continue to operate her business, Milagros is requesting a loan of 8,000 PHP. She will utilize the loan to buy orders for her customers. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Milagros dreams of being able to expand her business. She faithfully meets with her co-fellowship members every week to share stories of her work and to also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of fifteen to thirty community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional supplies and merchandise products needed for her business.

loans.name: Suy

texts.en:
Suy (pictured here) is 59 years-old and his wife, Bunna, is 60 years-old.  They live in a village about 17 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have nine children:  two sons and seven daughters. Four are married and live separately and the others are garment workers.  

Suy is a fisherman and a chef. He cooks for wedding parties and other occasions. His wife sells fish that her husband catches.
 
Suy is applying for a loan in the amount of $1,000 in order to purchase a motorbike for his daughter who is a garment worker so she can drive to work.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for his daughter to get to work.

loans.name: Koim

texts.en:
Koim, age 39, is very hardworking and has been operating a rice farming business as the family's source of income. Her four children serve as her motivation in pursuing her farming business. She has been in this field for many years and earns around 2.50 USD per day. She has a strong determination to succeed in her business and support her children's education. She wants to help them achieve at least a high school level of education.

Koim has inadequate capital to invest in her farming business, so she is asking for a loan in the amount of 1,500,000 KHR to purchase fertilizers and pay for labor costs incurred in transplanting rice. Koim will be able to ensure a high rice production through her hard work and the help of the loan. She is confident to pay back her loan with her generated income in the coming harvest season.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and pay for labor costs incurred in transplanting rice.

loans.name: Sous

texts.en:
Sous is 32 years-old and the loving mother of four children.  She is a local farmer living in Baray district of Kompong Tom province. She cultivates rice on her existing farmland while her husband trades animals to provide the family income. This couple agree to educate their children, so that they may have good jobs in the future. Together, they can make around USD 4.00 per day towards the household expenses. 

With the loan amount of KHR 700,000, Sous will add to her own capital in order to buy a piece of land to grow her business. She will use her generated income to pay back the lenders according to the schedule, and later she can till the land to make profit for her family. Her goal is to raise her family out of poverty and provide a comfortable living and education to her children.

loans.use: to buy a piece of land to grow her business.

loans.name: Criselda

texts.en:
This is Criselda, 52 years-old and a resident of Bacoor, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Eddie, a driver, and is the mother of three children, one of whom is already in high school, and two who are staying at home. By the grace of God, Criselda has managed to support her children's schooling. At this time, she is working hard to be able to send all of them all the way through college. For most Filipino parents, like Criselda, as she herself has been a high school graduate, they believe that a college diploma is the best inheritance parents can leave to their children.

Criselda maintains a direct selling business. She sells clothing, footwear, undergarments, cosmetics and other products through the popular direct selling brands like Avon, Fullerlife, Natasha, Boardwalk, Marikina Shoe Exchange, and other direct selling brands. A customer's order is bought in cash by the dealer and then given to the customer with one month to pay on credit. Dealer’s prices are lower than those in the catalogue, and these are the profits that dealers invest as their income. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of Php200 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php9,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy orders for her customers. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 
 
Criselda dreams to be able to give all her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work in her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and she also draws strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional supplies and merchandise products needed in her business.

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
This is Lilia, 48 years-old and a resident of Bacoor, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Raymundo, a supervisor, and she a mother. She, together with her husband and children, manage their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Lilia operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, Php5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. Lilia earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php 400 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 8,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Lilia hopes to be able to expand soon. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and she also draws strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional stock of supplies and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Sakhon

texts.en:
Sakhon (pictured here) and his wife, Lun, are 65 years old. They live in a village about seventeen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have five children: three sons and two daughters. Three are married, one is a garment worker and another is hired to farm and gets paid with fees.  

Sakhon and his wife are vegetable farmers. Sakhon looks old, but he is still strong enough to work. He is asking for a loan in the amount of $1,500 to maintain his vegetable farm by buying pesticide, fertilizer and seeds. He will use a part of the loan to pay fees for the rental of more plots of farmland on which to grow vegetables, in order to increase the volume of his productivity.

loans.use: to maintain his vegetable farm by buying pesticide, fertilizer and seeds, and to pay fees for the rental of more plots of farmland on which to grow vegetables.

loans.name: Rokyah

texts.en:
Rokyah (in the photo) sells fish, that her husband catches, in the local market. Her husband, Hit, is a fisherman. They live in a village about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have been married since 2001 and have two young children. Rokyah's family is Cham Muslim. The Cham are an ethnic minority in Cambodia. 

Rokyah is requesting a loan in the amount of $150 to assist in her husband's fishing business by buying new fishing nets, because theirs are old and breaking.

loans.use: to assist in her husband's fishing business by buying new fishing nets, because theirs are old and breaking.

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita is 40 years old and lives in Upper Langcangan, Oroquieta City. She is married with three children. 

Nenita sells dried fish to earn a living and has had this business for five years. She has requested a loan of 13,000 Philippine pesos (Php) to purchase more dried fish. 

Nenita has been a member of PMPC for seven years. In the future, she hopes to own a store that sells a wide variety of dried fish.

loans.use: to purchase more dried fish to sell.

loans.name: Adelaida

texts.en:
Adelaida is married with three children. She is 52 years old and lives in Salvador, Calamba, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She owns and farms a plot of land, growing bananas to earn a living. She has been in this business for four years and earns 4,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) each month. She has requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase agricultural chemicals. 

Adelaida has been a member of Kiva's partner, GDMPC, since 2008. In the future, Adelaida's plan is to save her profits in order to buy a car.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural chemicals.

loans.name: Mutinda

texts.en:
Mutinda operates a shop and grocery store for a living. He previously acquired a loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) from Faulu Kenya which helped him to buy sugar, rice, tomatoes and fruits. He has also been able to grow his business because he has been trained in business management. 

Mutinda needs a loan of 30,000 KES to buy more rice, tomatoes, potatoes and charcoal for resale. He dreams of operating a wholesale business in the future.

loans.use: to buy rice, tomatoes, potatoes and charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Assane

texts.fr: Monsieur Assane habite au Sénégal. Il est célibataire et vit avec sa famille. Il évolue dans le secteur du commerce depuis plus de 10 ans. Il pratique la vente   de meubles de chambre tels que  chaises,  armoires…etc. il est membre  de l’un des guichets de l’U-IMCEC et à déjà remboursé un prêt antérieur. Présentement, il sollicite un  crédit d’un montant de 150.000 francs CFA  dans l’objectif de mieux développer son activité de commerce de meubles. Par conséquent il espère accroitre ses revenus pour mieux  supporter les charges de contribution aux dépenses de la famille familiales( parents). Son second objectif consiste aussi a accroitre le niveau de son épargne. Son projet futur est de se marier et de fonder une famille.
texts.en: Mr. Assane works in Senegal. He is single and lives with his parents. He has been working as a vendor for over 10 years. He sells household furniture such as chairs, wardrobes etc. He is a member of one of the U-IMCEC branches and has already repaid a prior loan. At present, he is seeking a loan in the amount of 150,000 West African francs in order to better develop his furniture business. Therefore, he expects to grow his revenues in order to contribute more to the family expenses. His second goal is to bolster his savings. His future project is to get married and start his own family.

loans.use: to buy furniture for resale.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter previously acquired a loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) which helped him to buy sugar, cooking fat, rice and soap. With the additional stock, he made more profits. Through Faulu Kenya, he has been trained on business management which has helped him to expand his business and to become successful. He hopes to open another outlet in a different location.

Peter has requested a loan of 100,000 KES to buy a kerosene pump to start a new business selling kerosene.

loans.use: to buy a kerosene pump.

loans.name: Angelie

texts.en: Angelie, 39, is married with two children and lives in Bunawan, Calamba, Misamis Occidental. In order to support the daily needs of her family, five years ago Angelie entered into a business buying and selling fruit. She usually earns 3,500 Philippine pesos (PHP) per month. With the help of GDMPC Microcredit, which she joined last year, Angelie was able to obtain more fruit to sell because of the 4,000 PHP loaned to her. Someday, she’s hoping for much greater revenue to allow for business expansion.

loans.use: to obtain more fruit to sell.

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena, 36, is a resident of Bacoor, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Salvador, a welder, and is mother to three children, wherein one is still not of school age and two are in elementary school. She, together with her husband, manages her household while operating a business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Rowena operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which sells groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, 5 PHP worth of cooking oil, or an egg. Rowena earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling them by the unit. Her store is adjacent to her house and her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 400 PHP in sales every day.

To help her continue her business operations, Rowena is requesting a loan of 11,000 PHP to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her income as she expands her business.

Rowena hopes to soon be able to expand and to give her children a good education. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional stocks of supplies and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Marichu

texts.en:
Marichu is 46 years old and lives in Polangyuta, Siquijor, Siquijor. She is a single mother with two school-age children. To earn a living, Marichu provides manicure services and earns approximately 1,500.00 Philippine pesos (PHP) each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 4,000 PHP to purchase assorted accessories to use for her manicure services.

Marichu is a newly recognized member of Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative since June 19, 2012.  

In the future, Marichu hopes to improve her living conditions and meet the daily needs of her family.

loans.use: to purchase assorted accessories to use for her manicure services.

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita is 58 years old and married with 10 children. She earns a living by raising hogs in the Philippines. Nenita has been raising hogs for 10 years and earns additional income from abaca weaving (abaca is fibre from palm leaves).

Nenita is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane operates a cafeteria for a living. She previously acquired a loan of 20,000 KES from Faulu Kenya which helped her to buy wheat flour, maize, beans and milk for her business. She has also learnt how to save because she has been trained in financial management. 

Jane dreams of expanding her business in the future. She needs a loan of 40,000 KES to buy milk, maize flour, sugar and wheat flour.

loans.use: To buy milk, maize flour, sugar and wheat flour

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is 43 years old and married. She prepares doughnuts for sale to make a living. She has been in this business for more than five years. Esther previously acquired a loan from Faulu Kenya which helped her to grow her business. She has also learnt how to save because she has been trained in financial management. 

Since Esther does not have a permanent outlet, she hopes that she will have one in the future. She needs a loan of 40,000 KES to buy an oven, utensils and wheat flour.

loans.use: To buy an oven, utensils and wheat flour

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Josefina is 57 years old and married with four children. She works very hard to provide for them. Josefina runs a sari-sari (general) store in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 15 years and sells a variety of items such as snack foods, canned goods and other groceries.
