Her business strategy is to sell her products outside of large stores. She has found that this is where many people are each day. 

Clarisse has received one previous loan from Kiva's partner, Hope Congo. She has a good repayment record. She hopes to one day open a shop to sell her products in.

loans.use: to pay for three bags of flour.

loans.name: Cholpon

texts.ru:
Чолпон  46 лет, замужем, имеет 2 детей. Чолпон в качестве основного источника дохода для своей семьи, с 2010 года занимается животноводством начав этот бизнес с суммы в 50,000 сом. Благодаря упорному труду Чолпон в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний  день имеется  2 коровы с приплодом, 40 овец, 1 лошадь, продажа молока приносит около 3,000 сом в месяц. 
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Чолпон обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 80,000 сом (KGS)  на покупку дополнительных голов скота.  Доходы от кредита Чолпон будет вкладывать в дальнейшее развитие бизнеса посредством посадки картофеля на 0,5 га земли.
texts.en: Cholpon is 46 years old, married and has two children.  To provide the primary source of income for her family, she has been involved in animal husbandry since 2010, having started this business with a sum of 50,000 som.  Thanks to Cholpon's hard work, today her business contains two cows with offspring, forty sheep and one horse, and the sales of milk yield about 3,000 som per month.  In order to further develop her business, Cholpon requested a loan in the amount of 80,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company to buy additional livestock.  She plans to invest the earnings from the loan into a continued development of her business by planting potatoes on 0.5 hectares of land.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Les Vainqueurs 1 Group

texts.en:
Jean Didier, age 52 years, is married and has 9 children, ages 5 to 24. All of his children are currently attending school. He also cares for his elderly father. 

Jean Didier is representing the Les Vainqueurs 1 group. He operates a grocery stand in a local market. He sells various food and household products that are in demand in his community. He has gained valuable experience over the 30 years he has had this business. He will use the loan to buy sugar, spaghetti, and cans of sardines for resale. His business strategy is to buy in bulk from his supplier, thus lowering the price per item. He will be able to buy in bulk and gain a better price because of the loan he will receive. 

Jean Didier has received 4 previous loans from Kiva's partner, HOPE Congo. He has a good repayment record. He hopes to build a large boutique for his business one day.

loans.use: to pay for sugar, spaghetti, and cans of sardines for resale.

loans.name: Kubra's Group

texts.en:
Kubra is very active lady. She performs her household duties very well by staying at home.

Her husband does have a job, but his income is not enough to support the whole family. That’s why her three elder sons left their education and started different kinds of work to contribute to the family financially.

Kubra has applied for a loan from KIVA partner Asasah for her eldest son, who operates a grocery store in the market. With the loan investment, he will buy grocery items such as spices, sugar, and cooking oils in larger quantity. This will help him fulfill client orders on time and increase his sales and income.

He has been operating his business for many years.  Kubra is hopeful that his business will get more success after investing a loan.

loans.use: To buy grocery items for her son's grocery store.

loans.name: Estrella De Luz Group

texts.es:
El grupo Estrella de Luz lo conforman tres personas trabajadoras y emprendedoras la coordinadora del grupo es Marlene de 64 años de edad quien se dedica a la venta de ropa usada, chiverías, hielo y helado desde hace 6 años aproximadamente. Esta señora Jovial  quien tiene 8 hijos de los cuales dos de ellos le ayudan en el comercio y menciono que gracias a los créditos con las ganancias a logrado realizar mejoras en su hogar.
Actualmente ella desea invertir en la poner una venta de comida los fines de semana.
Las otras integrantes son Zeneyda de 33 años la cual tiene una comideria desde hace varios años y Heyling quien hace un año inicio una comideria.
texts.en:
The 'Estrella de Luz' group is made up of three hard-working, entrepreneurial people.  The group coordinator is 64-year-old Marlene who has been selling used clothing, snacks, ice and iced treats for approximately six years.  This cheerful lady has eight children, two of whom help her in her business.  She mentions that, thanks to the loans she has received, she has been able to use her profits to make improvements to her home.  She would currently like to invest in setting up a food sales business which she will run on weekends.

The other members of this group are 33-year-old Zeneyda, who has run an eatery for several years, and Heyling, who set up an eatery one year ago.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, meat and perishables

loans.name: Khadicha

texts.ru:
Хадиче 51 год, замужем. Хадича в качестве основного источника дохода для своей семьи, с 1994 года занимается животноводством, начав этот бизнес с суммы в 15,000 сом. Благодаря упорному труду Хадичи в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний  день имеется  3 коровы с приплодом, 10 овец, 1 лошадь, продажа молока приносит около 9,000 сом в месяц. 
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Хадича обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 30,000 сом (KGS)  на покупку дополнительных голов скота на откорм.  Доходы от кредита Хадича будет вкладывать в оплату обучения для дочери.
texts.en: Khadicha is 51 years old, married.  To provide the primary source of income for her family, she has been involved in animal husbandry since 1994, having started this business with a sum of 15,000 som.  Thanks to Khadicha's hard work, today her business contains three cows with offspring, ten sheep and one horse, and the sales of milk yield about 9,000 som per month.  In order to further develop her business, Khadicha requested a loan in the amount of 30,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company to buy additional livestock for fattening up.  She plans to invest the earnings from the loan paying for her daughter's education.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Yuriy

texts.ru:
В 2006г. Юрий заключил договор с научно исследовательским институтом занимающимся  проблемой выращивания ягодников, овощных культур на капельном орошении и посадил свои первые 50 саженцев  винограда. Так началась его фермерская деятельность.
По хозяйству ему помогает сын,  который работает мастером на заводе.
На новых земельных  участка, Юрий решил высадить  100 саженцев винограда.
В планах на будущее: поставить теплицу для выращивания на продажу саженцев  винограда;  купить  мини-трактор  для обработки земельных участков, а также приобрести холодильную установку для хранения винограда.
В личных планах: постройка дома.
texts.en: Yuriy came to an agreement with a scientific research institute involved in issues of growing berry fields and vegetable crops with drip irrigation in 2006 and planted his first 50 grape vines.  This is how his farming business began.  His son, who works as a repairman at a factory, helps him with the business.  Yuriy decided to plant 100 grape vines on his new plots of land.  His future plans include building a greenhouse to grow grape vines for sale, buying a mini-tractor to treat his land plots and also buying a refrigerator for storing grapes.  His personal plans include building a house.

loans.use: to purchase farming equipment

loans.name: Fahmi

texts.en:
Fahmi is a 24-year-old, single man running a mini-market business. Over the years, he has grown his trade gradually from a convenience store to what it is now. Currently, he sells groceries, detergents, toiletries, soft drinks and tobacco products. He enjoys the loyalty of his customers who are satisfied with the quality of his products and reasonable pricing.

Fahmi is applying for a Youth Loan from Kiva’s partner, Al Majmoua, to stock merchandise before Ramadan, the Islamic month of fasting. During that period, demand for foodstuffs rises substantially due to the habit of giving large feasts and community gatherings. For this, Fahmi has to be prepared to serve the needs of his crowded neighborhood and keep up to the competition from other traders.

loans.use: to purchase stocks of merchandise before Ramadan, the Islamic month of fasting.

loans.name: Los Bailarines Group

texts.es:
El grupo los Bailarines lo conforman tres personas trabajadoras y emprendedoras una de ellas es María quien se dedica a la venta de cosméticos desde hace 3 años e invertirá en perfumes, cremas y cosméticos para cumplir con unos encargos que tiene.
Las otras integrantes son Jenny quien se dedica a la venta de ropa y cosméticos desde hace 8 años y Alex quien es transportistas desde hace 3 años.
texts.en:
The Los Bailarines ["The Dancers"] Group is comprised of three hard-working and enterprising individuals one of whom is Maria, who have been selling cosmetics for three years and will invest in perfumes, creams, and cosmetics in order to fulfill the orders she has.

The other members are Jenny, who has been selling clothes and cosmetics for eight years, and Alex, who has been in the transportation business for three years.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, creams, and cosmetics

loans.name: Williams

texts.es:
Williams tiene 27 años. Vive en la casa que heredó de sus padres, quienes fallecieron hace dos años. Ahora vive junto a sus dos hermanos en la ciudad de Pampas.  
En honor a su madre todas las mañanas, desde muy temprano, cuida de su tienda de comestibles que queda en su misma vivienda. Cuenta que la tienda era de su madre, quien después de su muerte le heredó. Por ello la cuida con mucha dedicación, a pesar de haber estudiado la carrera de ingeniería eléctrica en una universidad, él continúa en el negocio. “Trabajo en un proyecto de electrificación para el estado, ese trabajo es eventual depende de cuando tiempo dure el proyecto”, afirma. Ese es su principal problema, ya que en esa temporada cierra la tienda y sólo abre en sus tiempos libres. En la actualidad desea incrementar algunos productos alimenticios que le solicitaron sus clientes.

Este es el tercer crédito que tiene con MFP y en todo este tiempo pudo solventar algunas necesidades de su negocio, gracias al apoyo financiero obtenido. Por ello, promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas, ya que no quiere fallar a los miembros de su asociación, que son personas responsables. 
Williams invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de productos de primera necesidad para su tienda de comestibles.
texts.en:
Williams is 27 years old. He lives in the house that he inherited from his parents, who died two years ago. He now lives with his two brothers in the city of Pampas.

In honor of his mother, starting very early every day, he takes care of her grocery store, which is located in the house. He says that the store was his mother's and he inherited it after she died. For this reason he takes care of it with great dedication. In spite of having studied for an electrical engineering career at a university, he continues with the business. "I work on an electrification project for the state, that job is temporary work depending on how long the project lasts," he says. That is his main problem, since during that time he closes the store and only opens during his free time. Currently he wants to add some food products that his customers asked him for. 

This is his third loan with MFP, and during this time he has been able to cover some of the needs of his business, thanks to the financial support obtained. Because of this, he promises to be punctual with his repayments, since he does not want to fail the members of his association, who are responsible people.

Williams will use the money requested to purchase staple products for his grocery store.

loans.use: to purchase staple products to stock his grocery store

loans.name: Sanan

texts.en:
Sanan is a 32-year-old man, married, with two children. He is an Internally Displaced Person and lives with his family in the Bilasuvar IDP Settlement.   He breeds sheep and cattle and additionally sells milk products and meat. Sanan has more than five years of experience in this field, thanks to his father, who taught him the best way to look after cattle. 

Sanan usually buys lambs, raises and fattens them in three to six months, and resells them for a more profitable price in the local livestock bazaar.  Milk and yogurt, he sells to his neighbors.  Selling milk and meat brings in 150 AZN income per month.  Milk and yogurt are very popular products in Azerbaijan, as are beef and mutton.  People use meat in everyday national dishes like pilau and dolma, and they always use yogurt. Milk products are considered very healthy, and they are also present in everyday life.   

There is only one income in Sanan's family, and it is not enough to cover the basic needs of his beloved children. Sanan applied for a loan of 1,000 AZN to purchase six sheep, one cow, and fodder.

loans.use: to buy six sheep, one cow, and fodder

loans.name: Martha Yaqueline

texts.es:
En el sector del Colegio Uruguay en la ciudad de Portoviejo conocido como La Ciudad De Los Reales Tamarindos, ciudad bella y hospitalaria, se reúnen cada quince días las socias del Banco Comunal Buenos Amigos.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Martha, tiene 32 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres  hijos 14 y 6 años de edad y el último de dos meses, el mayor estudia en colegio y el siguiente en escuela. Su esposo es empleado privado.

Nuestra amiga con la intención de ganar algo por su cuenta  para con esto poder salir adelante y ayudar también a su esposo con la dura carga que genera el hogar se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo y bisutería, su forma de venta es puerta a puerta y también vende en su  casa donde tiene un pequeño local, trabaja todos los días, deja a crédito a sus clientes  y cobra cada quince días. Su mercadería la va a comprar a Guayaquil y también le envían desde los Estados Unidos ya que tiene familiares en este país. Tiene tres años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien.

Este crédito es para comprar ropa, carteras, bisutería y otras cosas que ella vende. Este es su primer ciclo en el Banco Comunal, le gusta por la rapidez con que salió el crédito.
 
Su sueño es darles lo mejor a sus hijos.
texts.en:
The members of Banco Comunal Buenos Amigos meet every fifteen days in the sector of Colegio Uruguay in the beautiful and friendly city of Portoviejo, also known as "The City of the Royal Tamarinds".

Martha, 32, lives in this area. She is married and has three children -- a two-month-old baby, a six-year-old, and a fourteen-year-old.  The older children are currently in school.  Her husband is privately employed.

So that she can make some of her own income to be able to help her husband meet the household expenses, our friend sells clothing of all types as well as jewelry.  She works door-to-door and also sells her merchandise out of her home, where she has a small shop. She works every day, extending credit to her customers and collecting every fifteen days.  She goes to Guayaquil to buy her merchandise, and some of her relatives also send her products from the United States to sell.  She has had this business for three years, and things are going very well.

This loan is to buy clothes, purses, jewelry and other items that she sells.  This is her first loan with the communal bank.  She is pleased with how quickly she is able to get a loan through the bank.  Her dream is to be able to provide the best for her children.

loans.use: to buy clothes, purses, jewelry and other items for resale.

loans.name: Fedor

texts.ru:
На протяжении 3-х лет сельский фермер Федор занимается выращиванием сладкого перца, малины и картофеля.
По хозяйству ему помогают  двое детей.  Старшему сыну 19 лет, он учится в университете на музыканта.  Младший  сын   учится  в школе, ему 15 лет.
Ранее Федор занимался выращиванием петрушки и укропа в теплицах.
Для повышения урожая было принято решение  приобрести агро волокно, пленку и  систему капельного полива.
На будущее в планах Федора - поставить еще две теплицы, а также увеличить площади под посадку  малины и чеснока.
texts.en:
Fedor is a village farmer who has been cultivating sweet peppers, raspberries and potatoes for the last three years. His children help him in this business. His oldest son is nineteen years old and he is studying to be a musician at the university. His younger son goes to school, he is fifteen years old.

Earlier Fedor used to grow parsley and dill in the greenhouse. To increase the yield it was decided to purchase agro fiber, film and drip irrigation. In the future Fedor plans to install two greenhouses as well as to increase the area for planting raspberries and garlic.

loans.use: to purchase farming equipment.

loans.name: Deo-Gracias 2 Group

texts.en:
Clarisse is 44 years old, married, with six children, ages 5 to 26 years old. She has three children attending school. She also cares for her father. 

Clarisse is representing the Deo-Gracias 2 group. She sells children's clothing and has been operating this business for five years. She will use the loan to buy children's clothing and sandals to restock her supply. Her business strategy is to keep a large variety and quantity of clothes at her stand. She is also willing to negotiate with clients and find the best price. 

Clarisse has received one previous loan from Kiva's partner, HOPE Congo. She did well with her first loan. She would like to open up a grocery stand one day. She is saving and planning for this transition.

loans.use: to buy children's clothing and sandals to restock her supply.

loans.name: Kassem

texts.en:
Kassem is a 27-year-old single man who has run an Internet café with his father for more than eight years now. He offers Internet access and a digital gaming network to his customers, who are mostly teenagers. Throughout the years, he succeeded in building a respectful reputation for his place, whilst maintaining quality service and competitive prices.

Kassem is always keen on developing and expanding his business.  He has already saved some money, and he is applying for a Youth Loan from Kiva’s partner, Al Majmoua, to complete what he needs. He will use the loan to pave the entrance to his shop and to buy new computers for $550 each.

loans.use: to buy new computers for his Internet cafe and pave the entrance.

loans.name: Vincent

texts.en:
Omania has been active in farming at his rural home in Nyamira, South Rift, Kenya, where he lives with his wife and one child, aged 3 years. His eight years in farming has enabled him meet his family's basic needs. 

His farm currently produces milk, vegetables, maize, and beans, which he sells to the local market. He manages his farm with the help of two farmhands. He runs a small agro-vet shop, mainly serving local dairy farmers, and he also makes building bricks, which he sells to residents doing construction.

Omania has made a loan request of 60,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo.  The money will help him construct a modern dairy unit and buy a power generator to help pump water for his animals and the farm in general. He is focusing on booting up his agro-vet business and buying more land in the future.

He notes that pests, drought, and hailstones are the occasional major challenges.

loans.use: To buy a power generator and buiild a modern dairy unit.

loans.name: Zeinab

texts.en:
Zeinab is a 56-year-old married woman and the mother of three children. She has worked as a tailor from home for more than 20 years, mainly in fixing and patching clothing. Zeinab’s customers are quite satisfied with her fine-finishing and good prices.

To maintain her quality service, Zeinab needs to buy a new sewing machine, since her current one is not working right. For this purpose, she is applying for a loan from Kiva’s partner, Al Majmoua.  With the new machine, Zeinab will be able to carry on her work without difficulty and retain her customers. She will even increase her production rate and have the capacity to serve more clients.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine

loans.name: Joseline Nohemi

texts.es:
Joseline tiene 20 años de edad, tiene un hijo. Ella lleva dos años dedicándose a la elaboración y venta de antojitos como: enredos, tostadas, enchiladas, pastelitos, tacos, etc. Esta actividad la aprendió de una hermana, que tenia un negocio similar en donde Joseline le ayudo durante tres años y poco a poco fue adquiriendo el equipo para instalar su propio negocio. Los materiales para elaborar los antojitos los compra en dos ciudades del oriente del país.

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para construir una galera en su negocio para que sus clientes degusten sus alimentos y se protejan del sol y del agua. Lo que ella desea es mejorar las instalaciones de su local, para que lleguen más clientes y sus ingresos sean mejores. Con el objetivo de adquirir todo lo necesario para su hijo, ya que todos los gastos corren por su propia cuenta.
texts.en:
Joseline is 20 years old and has a son.  For the past two years she has been making and selling snacks such as enredos, tostadas, enchiladas, pastelitos, tacos and other items.  She learned these skills when she was helping her sister, who has a similar business.  She did this for three years and little by little acquired the capital to go into business for herself.  She buys her ingredients from two cities in the eastern part of the country.

She is seeking this loan so that she can build a covered patio so that her customers can enjoy their meals and be protected from the sun and rain.  She wants to make this improvement to her location so that she can attract more customers and increase her income.  Her underlying goal is to be able to provide her son with everything he needs, since she is paying for all of his expenses on her own.

loans.use: to build a covered patio so that her customers can enjoy their meals and be protected from the sun and rain.

loans.name: Majeda

texts.en:
Majeda is a 32-year-old married woman who is caring for three kids.

Last time, she took a loan to help her husband in his store.  But now Majeda has started selling clothes at home, mainly for ladies.  In the photo, Majeda is showing a sample of what she has for sale. 

Majeda wants to bring in more clothes in different styles from the free trade zone and wholesale market.  To pay for that, she has applied for this loan.

loans.use: to buy more clothes for her new business.

loans.name: Rivas Quinto

texts.es: Alexy vive en el Fortín, a sus 37 años tiene una venta de ropa deportiva. Es madre soltera de niños de 8 y 18 años de edad. Empezó este negocio hace 4 años atrás cuando decidió vender camisetas con logotipos de equipos de futbol de mayor reconocimiento a las afuera de los estadios sobre todo en los campeonatos nacionales. En la actualidad sus hijos le ayudan en el negocio los fines de semana y cuando hay partidos importantes. Ofrece variedad ya que hay para niños y grandes, también viseras, pañuelos, manoplas etc. su mayor preocupación es la delincuencia ya que en las multitudes es cuando aprovechan para robar. Con el préstamo comprara mercadería por mayor para vender por unidad. Desea progresar mas a futuro para brindarles a sus hijos todo el apoyo que necesiten.
texts.en:
Alexy lives in Fortín and at 37 years old she sells sports apparel. She is a single mother of children who are 8 and 18 years old. She began this business four years ago when she decided to sell shirts with the logos of well-recognized soccer teams outside of the stadiums, overall of the national soccer championships. Currently her children help her in the business on the weekends and when there are important games. 

She offers a variety that are for children and larger, also visors, handkerchiefs and gloves, etc. Her largest worry is the delinquency since in the crowds is when they take the opportunity to rob. With this loan she will buy wholesale merchandise to sell individually. She hopes to progress more in the future to bring her children all of the help that they need.

loans.use: to purchase sports clothes for resale

loans.name: José Maximino

texts.es:
El señor José tiene 41 años de edad, es casado y tiene cinco años. Desde hace 8 años se dedica a trabajar con cerdos, él siempre a tenido un cerdo; pero hoy en día, él se esta dedicando específicamente a la crianza de varios cerdos.

Antes él se dedicaba a la agricultura, pero poco a poco a trabajado solo con cerdos y en la construcción. Don José compra el concentrado y los desparacitantes de sus cerdos en una comunidad, para llegar ahí, tiene que buscar un vehículo que le haga los viajes hasta la comunidad ya que no tiene como desplazarse y la ciudad le queda a 5 minutos en vehículo. 

El  préstamo que esta solicitando sera utilizado para la compra de concentrado para los cerdos y para la compra de insumos agrícolas, ya que él espera seguir cosechando sus propios cultivos. Con la compra de los insumos agrícolas y  del concentrado sus animales estarán mas cuidados y ademas tendrá mejor alimentación para luego su comercialización. Con los insumos agrícolas su necesidad que satisface es que logra tener sus propios granos básicos.
Con la inversión, se logra que él tenga un trabajo estable, ya que se dedicara a su granja de cerdos y también él lograra tener mas insumos para la cosecha que esta realizando, darle un buen mantenimiento.
 
Su propósito es ser un gran comerciante de cerdos en la zona; también buscar la forma de que su hija continué estudiando, ya que es ella la que le gusta estudiar y seguir creciendo económicamente con otro negocio del ganado.
texts.en:
José, 41, is married and has five children.  He’s worked with pigs for the last 8 years.  He’s always had a pig and today he’s specifically working raising several pigs.

He used to work in agriculture but gradually started working just with pigs and in construction.  José buys feed concentrate and deparasitizers for his pigs in a community that in order to reach he has to find a vehicle that makes trips to that community since he has no way of transporting himself and the city is five minutes away by car.

The loan he’s requesting will be used to buy feed concentrate for the pigs and to buy farm supplies since he hopes to continue to grow his own crops.  
With the purchase of farm supplies and animal feed they will be better cared for and they will be better fed for subsequent sale.  With respect to the farm supplies the need he’ll meet is to have his own basic grains.

With this investment he will have stable work since he will work in his pig farm and also will have more supplies to provide care for the crops he’s growing.  His goal is to be a great pig merchant in the zone and also to find a way for his daughter to continue in school since she likes to study and to continue growing economically with another livestock business.

loans.use: to buy pig feed and farm supplies.

loans.name: Mi Niño Jesus De Iv Programa Group

texts.es:
La señora Giuliana tiene 34 años de edad y es integrante del grupo “Mi niño Jesús de IV Programa” conformado por 07 personas desde hace más de un año, todos ellos muy trabajadores y emprendedores. La señora Giuliana es madre de 03 niños, todos ellos menores de edad y en etapa escolar. Ella dedica su tiempo diario a atender y administrar su pequeña librería, con los ingresos por las ventas puede darles educación a sus 03 hijos; cabe mencionar, que ella es el único sostén de su hogar.  El préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de útiles escolares para poder ampliar su negocio.
La señora Giuliana es la cuarta de la izquierda, viste casaca roja y polo negro.
texts.en:
Giuliana, who is 34 years old, is one of the members of the group "Mi Niño Jesus de IV Programa". The group was formed over a year ago and has 7 members who work and fight day after day  to improve the financial situation in their homes. 

An example of this is that Giuliana, who has three children that are minors, works daily to tend the small bookstore in her house. With the earnings from the sales she can provide an education to her three children. It should be mentioned that she is the only person who sustains her home economically. 

She will use the loan to invest in the purchase of school supplies to make her business bigger. 

Sra. Giuliana is on the 4th from the left, in a red jacket and black shirt.

loans.use: to buy school supplies for her library

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.es: Marcelina tiene 63 años y está casada con Gilberto un productor de café y fue él quien le enseñó todo lo necesario para que ella también se dedicara a esta actividad. Ellos tienen 3 hijos ya casados pero que también les ayudan a trabajar en sus parcelas en la época de cosecha, pues hay muchas actividades por hacer. Ella y su esposo tienen 6,000 plantas de café y quieren tener para la próxima cosecha un total de 7,000. Las plantas nuevas que siembren les estarán dando frutos en un lapso de 3 años. Para poder alcanzar su meta necesitan de un crédito ya que aparte de invertir en las plantas nuevas también será necesario comprar fertilizantes para que crezcan fuertes y den un café de calidad. Ellos entregan su cosecha a la “Unión Regional de Huatusco” que se encarga de procesarlo y exportarlo. Con la ayuda del crédito ellos podrán aumentar su producción y sus ingresos, ya que en la zona donde viven el café es el único medio de trabajo.
texts.en:
Marcelina is 63 years old, and is married to Gilberto, who is a coffee grower.  It was he who taught her everything necessary so that she could also do this type of work. She has three children who are already married, but they also help her and her husband in their fields during the harvest season, since there are many things that need to be done.  They have 6,000 coffee plants and hope to have 7,000 for the next harvest.  The new plants that they plant will bear fruit after three years.  In order to achieve their goals they will need a loan, since apart from investing in new plants, they will also have to buy fertilizer so that they can grow strong and healthy plants that will produce high quality coffee beans.

They deliver their coffee to “Unión Regional de Huatusco”, which is in charge of processing and exporting the beans.  With this loan they will be able to increase their production and their income, since in the area where they live, growing coffee is the only way to make a living.

loans.use: to buy coffee plants.

loans.name: Carlos Alberto

texts.es:
Carlos es un hombre de 30 años, es soltero, vive con sus padres y hermanos en la ciudad de Nazca; él es una persona muy alegre, entusiasta y trabajadora, con un gran deseo de superación, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por salir adelante y apoyar a sus padres, quienes gracias a su esfuerzo lo apoyaron para que culminara sus estudios profesionales de Derecho; en sus ratos libres le gusta relajarse escuchando música y en algunas ocasiones cocina un delicioso Puré con Bisteck para compartir con su familia.
Con mucho empeño, entusiasmo y por iniciativa propia, desde hace varios años Carlos puso en marcha su pequeño negocio de venta de ropa, él realiza sus ventas de manera ambulatoria en el mercado de su ciudad; Carlos dedica a su negocio un aproximado de 12 horas diarias, él cree que su negocio marcha bien debido a que sus clientes los recomiendan por sus  productos y buena atención.  
Carlos se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de mercadería, tales como: casacas, pantalones, chompas, buzos, entre otras prendas de vestir de acuerdo a la estación; de esta manera Carlos podrá incrementar sus ventas e ingresos económicos, con los cuales espera poder ahorrar lo suficiente para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda lograr tener sus tienda comercial de venta de ropa.
texts.en:
Carlos, 30, is single living with his parents and siblings in the city of Nazca.  He’s a very cheerful, enthusiastic, hardworking person who very much wants to improve himself and who puts all his efforts into getting ahead and supporting his parents who thanks to their efforts supported him so that he could finish his professional Law studies.  In his free time he enjoys relaxing while listening to music and sometimes cooks a delicious “Puré con Bisteck” to share with his family.

With much effort, enthusiasm and initiative of his own, Carlos set up a small clothing sales business several years ago.  He sells in an ambulatory fashion in his city’s market.  He spends about 12 hours daily in his business and he believes that it runs well because his customers recommend him for his products and good service.

Carlos is very grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to the support he’s gotten he will be able to buy merchandise like jackets, pants, sweaters, sweatshirts, among other articles of seasonal clothing.  In this way, Carlos will be able to increase his sales and income hoping to be able to save enough so that in a not too distant future he can have a clothing store.

loans.use: to buy clothes.

loans.name: Asma

texts.en:
Asma is a 37-year-old married woman and the mother of four children. Four years ago, she started stocking stationery at her house and selling it to her friends and neighbors. This business allowed her to contribute to her household expenses and assist her husband in providing a respectable living for their children.

Asma is applying for a loan from Kiva’s partner, Al Majmoua, to buy more stationery, such as paper, copybooks, office supplies, and pens. The more she sells, the more she can save money from her revenues to fulfill her future business plan.  Asma has been accumulating savings to open up her own stationery store, separate from home.

loans.use: to buy more stationery such as paper, copybooks, office supplies and pens

loans.name: Rael

texts.en:
Rael is a resident of Kitale in western Kenya.  She has been in farming for 10 years, producing and selling maize, milk, and vegetables to the local market. She is married, with three children, aged between 1 and 12 years. She also runs a hotel in the local market.

Rael has requested a loan of 41,600 KES from Kiva partner Juhudi Kilimo to buy and insure a dairy cow. She is optimistic she will have enough milk both for her family and to sell for additional income to educate her children.

Rael says that animal diseases and price fluctuations in the local markets remain the major challenges.

loans.use: To buy and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Mujeres Decididas E Independientes Group

texts.es:
El padre de Susana  se dedica a la venta de mayólicas y cerámicos. Tiene 02 tiendas en una zona muy comercial donde los productos que vende son muy requeridos. Susana dirige una de las tiendas donde realiza las ventas  diarias y la atención a los clientes, ya son cerca de 08 años que su padre empezó el negocio antes solo tenían 01 tienda muy pequeña pero gracias a su trabajo arduo y mucho sacrificio  ahora tienen 02 tiendas, este trabajo es la principal fuente de ingreso para  su familia. Susana quiere abrir su propia tienda, los ingresos que percibe por su trabajo los ahorra para este fin; por otro lado, ella también se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza con lo cual puede cubrir sus necesidades básicas. El préstamo lo utilizará para comprar más productos de belleza ya que la demanda de dichos productos ha aumentado; además esto le ayudará para cumplir su meta de abrir su propia tienda de mayólicas y cerámicos. La alcancía a la cual pertenece es “ MUJERES DECIDIDAS E INDEPENDIENTES”  está conformada por 08 socias. 
*Susana aparece con chompa color fucsia y cartera blanca.
*En la parte inferior central se encuentran al lado izquierdo la Sra. lizzette y al lado derecho el Sr. Hernan.
texts.en:
Susana’s father sells tiles and ceramics.  He has two stores in a commercial area where these products are in great demand.  Susana manages one of these stores and is able to generate daily sales and attend to the customers.  It has been nearly eight years since her father started this business.  Prior to that they only had one very small store, but thanks to their hard work and many sacrifices, they now have two stores.  This business is the main source of income for their family.  

Susana wants to open her own store.  The income she has earned from working up to now has been saved up specifically for this purpose.  She also sells beauty products in order to earn additional income to cover a few basic necessities.  The loan she is receiving will be very useful for buying products that her customers have requested.  Her co-workers are her most frequent buyers.  She is a member of the Communal Bank “Mujeres Decidadas e Independientes” (Decisive and Independent Women), which consists of eight members.  

*Susana is the woman wearing a fuchsia-colored sweater and carrying a white purse.

loans.use: to buy beauty products.

loans.name: Maritza Elizabeth

texts.es:
Maritza es una mujer de 43 años,  vive en la ciudad de Ica, en el distrito de Santiago con sus 4 hijos, lastimosamente por diversas circunstancias desde hace varios años decidió separarse de su pareja, desde entonces ella ha sido madre y padres para sus hijos, Maritza siempre ha sido una mujer muy entusiasta y trabajadora, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos para sacar adelante a su familia; lamentablemente por la necesidad de trabajar y solventar sus gastos, no pudo cursar una carrera profesional, pero le hubiera gustado poder estudiar la carrera de Enfermería; en sus ratos lubres le gusta bailar y en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo Seco de Cabrito para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia y gracias al apoyo de su familia, desde hace 2 años Maritza puso en marcha su pequeño negocio de venta de abarrotes, ella realiza sus ventas en su hogar, dedica un aproximado de 12 horas diarias y puede atender un promedio de 15 clientes, Maritza cree que su negocio marcha bien debido a que sus clientes la recomiendan por sus buenos productos y su buena atención.
Martiza se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de mercadería para su negocio, tales como: arroz, azúcar, leche, aceite, gaseosas, entre otros artículos, así también utilizará la ayuda para comprar andamios y mostradores para exhibir sus productos; de esta manera Maritza tendrá su negocio mejor acondicionado y abastecido, incrementando sus ventas e ingresos económicos, con los cuales en un futuro no muy lejano espera poder utilizarlos para realizar la construcción de su vivienda con materiales adecuados, ya que actualmente su vivienda está construida de quincha y barro, y ella desea poder brindar mayor seguridad y bienestar para su familia.
texts.en:
Maritza, 43, lives in the city of Ica in Santiago District with her four children.  Sadly, for various circumstances she decided to separate from her spouse several years ago and since then she’s been both mother and father for her children.  Maritza has always been a very enthusiastic, hardworking woman.  She puts all her efforts into moving her family ahead.  Sadly, due to the need to work and cover her expenses, she was unable to study a professional career but would have liked to have studied Nursing.  In her free time she enjoys dancing and sometimes cooks a delicious “Seco de Cabrito” to share with her family.

Through her own initiative and thanks to support from her family Maritza started a small, home-based grocery store two years ago.  She spends about 12 hours daily at work and can take care of up to 15 customers.  Maritza believes that her business is doing well thanks to her customers recommending her for her good products and service.

Maritza is very grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to the support they give her she’ll be able to buy merchandise for her store like rice, sugar, milk, oil, soft-drinks, among other items and she will also use the help to buy shelving and display cases to display her products.  In this way Maritza will have her store better equipped and stocked thus increasing her sales and income with which in the not too distant future she hopes to build her house with adequate materials since her current house is built out of reeds and mud and she wants to give greater security and wellbeing to her family.

loans.use: to buy merchandise, shelving and display cases.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph is a 57-year-old married man. He has five children with ages ranging from 15 to 32 years old. He describes himself as an organized and focused man. He operates a motorcycle and he provides transportation, rental houses accomodation and sells home products and milk. He has been involved in this business for five years and employs a staff member. His business is located within a highly populated area and his primary customers are businesspeople and local residents. He describes his biggest business challenge to be the high price of home products. He will use the KES 5,800 loan to buy a solar lantern. His business goal is to own many rental houses within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will purchase land in his hometown.

loans.use: to buy a solar lantern.

loans.name: Jean De Dieu

texts.en:
Jean De Dieu is married, with three children, aged between 5 and 10; all three children attend school.  He has been a maize farmer for two years, and his wife is a maize farmer, too. He would like to get this loan to buy and harvest seeds  and to pay for support labor to get the best harvest. With the profits, he wants to renovate his house and pay his children's school fees.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product; generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy and harvest seeds and hire support labor.

loans.name: Loice

texts.en:
Loice lives in Malindi, Kenya. She is married and has two children, both of whom are in school. She began farming over ten years ago. The only challenge she faces in this regard is the seasonal weather. Loice also owns a retail shop from where she sells cereals, flour and paraffin.

Loice learned of Milango from her friends. She is now applying for a loan of 21,050 KES to buy beans, maize flour, paraffin, etc. for her shop. She will save the extra income to educate her children. Her ambition is to open a wholesale shop.

loans.use: To purchase beans, maize flour, paraffin etc.

loans.name: Maoutondji Léonce's Group

texts.fr: Agée de 38 ans, Maoutondji Léonce est mariée et mère d'un enfant scolarisé. Elle a une boutique où elle vend des vêtements, des bijoux, des sacs et des chaussures depuis quelques années. Maoutondji Léonce fait ses approvisionnements dans la sous région. Dans le souci d'augmenter son capital et de répondre favorablement à la demande de ses clients, elle a sollicité et obtenu son micro crédit auprès de Finadev. Ce crédit lui permettra de renforcer son stock et de participer aux dépenses de la famille.
texts.en:
Maoutondji Léonce is 38 years of age, married, and has one child who is at school. She has a store where she sells clothing, jewelry, bags and shoes, and has done so for several years. She gets her supplies in the sub-region. 

To increase her capital and successfully meet customer demand, Maoutondji Léonce has requested and obtained a loan from Finadev. This will allow her to increase her stock, as well as to help with the family expenses.

loans.use: To buy two dozen sets of lingerie, one dozen shoes and eight pieces of ready-to-wear clothing.

loans.name: Kodjo

texts.fr: Kodjo est un jeune homme marié de 30 ans. Exerçant dans le domaine de la maintenance informatique, il effectue également de façon secondaire la vente de téléphone et  en fait également la réparation. Il est confronté au problème de manque d’argent ce qui ralentit de manière significative son activité. Kodjo opère son second crédit de WAGES et sollicite ce montant dans le but de s’approvisionner en téléphones. Il espère avec ce crédit faire beaucoup de profit et ainsi se réaliser sur le plan professionnel. Il souhaite avoir à l’avenir une grande boutique et un centre de formation.
texts.en:
Kodjo is a young, married man aged 30. He works in IT maintenance, and also has an additional job selling and repairing telephones. He has faced the problem of a lack of money, which has significantly slowed down his business. 

Kodjo is on his second loan from WAGES, and has requested this money to buy supplies of telephones. He hopes to use this loan to make much more profit, and therefore realize his professional plans. In the future, he would like to have a large store and a training center.

loans.use: To buy telephones.

loans.name: Sedotodé Grâce

texts.fr: Sedotodé Grâce est mariée et mère de quatre enfants scolarisés. Elle s'est spécialisée dans la vente des mèches et des habits depuis quelques années. Elle s'approvisionne dans l'un des marchés du marché du Bénin et sa clientèle est composée des habitants quartier et de ses environs. Expérimentée dans le crédit, elle a fait recours au financement de Finadev en vue de satisfaire ses clients et d'accroitre son revenu. Le gain dégagé lui permettra de contribuer à la scolarisation des enfants et d'avoir accès à l'électricité. Elle ambitionne ouvrir une boutique de mèches.
texts.en:
Sedotodé Grâce is a married mother of four children, all of whom are at school. She specializes in selling hair extensions and clothing, and has done so for several years. She gets her supplies from Benin market, and her customers all live in the neighborhood and the surrounding areas. 

Sedotodé Grâce has prior experience with loans, and has requested financing from Finadev to satisfy her customers’ needs and increase her income. Her profits will allow her to contribute to her children’s education, as well as to have access to electricity. She plans to open a hair extension store.

loans.use: To buy five dozen hair extensions and three packs of weaves.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy merchandise, shelving and a counter.

loans.name: Enrique

texts.es:
Don Enrique sigue laborando en servicios de seguridad, contando con el apoyo de su esposa, ya que también sigue vendiendo frutas, ayudándose para los gastos del hogar. Ya que ambos como objetivo es mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda.
Con este préstamo seguirá dando mejor condición de aseo personal  a su familia, ya que cerrara todo el baño de concreto y hará sus respectivas divisiones, ya que anteriormente al hacer el muro afecto esta mejora, lo que comprara materiales de construcción para seguir levantado las paredes y terminar ya que es de gran relevancia en su hogar.
texts.en:
Enrique continues working providing security services and having his wife’s support since she continues selling fruit helping each other to cover household expenses since they both share the objective of improving their living conditions.

With this loan he will continue to improve his family’s hygiene situation since he will enclose the entire bathroom with concrete and will make the respective divisions since erecting the previous wall affected this improvement.  He will buy building materials and supplies to continue erecting walls and to finish since this is of great relevance for his home.

loans.use: to buy building supplies to build a bathroom.

loans.name: Valeriy

texts.ru:
Более 12 – ти лет назад Валерий стал сельским фермером.   Выращивает  помидоры, огурцы, картофель и клубнику на земельной площади 75 соток. По хозяйству ему помогают супруга и двое его детей. Старшей  девочке 17 лет, она учится в институте.  Младшему сыну 14 лет, он учится в школе.
Для облегчения труда и обработки земельного участка решили приобрести мотоблок и почвофрезу.
В хозяйственных планах Валерия - расширить площадь посадки клубники с 6 до 20 соток, высадить саженцы малины на 10 сотках.
Семейные планы- достроить дом, помочь детям получить хорошее образование,  купить новую машину.
texts.en:
Valeriy became a village farmer more than twelve years ago. He grows tomatoes, cucumbers, potatoes and strawberries on 75 acres area of land. His spouse and two children help him in this business. His older daughter is seventeen years old and she goes to college. His younger son is fourteen years old and he goes to school.

To facilitate his work and processing of his land Valeriy and his family decided to purchase a walk-behind tractor and tillers. Valeriy's business plans are to expand the area for the ​​planting of strawberries from six to twenty acres and to plant the seedlings of raspberries on ten acres. His plans for the family are to finish building the house, help his children get a good education and to buy a new car.

loans.use: to purchase mechanical farming equipment.

loans.name: Rima

texts.en:
Rima, 23, is a housewife and a mother for three kids.

Rima has a small handmade embroidery business making pillows and table covers, beside other fabric pieces for decoration.

She has applied for this youth loan to buy more fabric and colorful threads to expand and increase the business she has.

loans.use: to buy more fabric and colorful threads.

loans.name: Mbodze

texts.en:
Mbodze is 32 years old and lives in Kenya. She is married, and the couple has four children living at home, all of whom attend school. Together they cover the various household expenses.

For the last three years Mbodze has operated a kiosk from which she sells basic goods to her neighbors. Thanks to the income this activity generates, she is able to contribute to meeting the family's expenses.

In order to meet her growing customer demands, Mbodze is seeking a 30,000 KES loan with Yehu. She will use it to buy more stock for her kiosk.

loans.use: to buy more stock for her kiosk.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa tiene 43 años, es una mujer amable, responsable y muy trabajadora. Se casó hace 18 años con Humberto, de 41 años, y fruto de su amor tienen cuatro hijos que aún dependen de ellos; sus edades son 18, 15, 12 y 7 años. Vive en la casa que pudo construir junto a su esposo gracias al esfuerzo que ponen cada uno en su trabajo.

Su negocio es la venta de abarrotes. Todos los días, desde muy temprano, abre las puertas de su tienda para atender a todos sus clientes que llegan hasta su establecimiento en busca de algún producto con la seguridad que ahí encontrarán lo que necesitan. Su bodega es la más surtida de su barrio y sus clientes no dudan en comprarle también por la calidad en las marcas que ofrece y el trato tan cordial. Recuerda que cuando se inició en este negocio no tenía muchos productos que ofrecer por lo que no lograba tener buenas ventas durante el día, eso la desanimaba a menudo, sin embargo buscó la solución, completó un pequeño capital y poco a poco fue implementando su pequeña tienda. Ahora le va muy bien en sus ventas y desde entonces hasta la actualidad han transcurrido 15 años de mucho trabajo. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es intercambiar con sus clientes instantes de felicidad, conversar con ellos y verlos empezar el día con una sonrisa, considera que lo más difícil es tener que levantarse temprano para atender su bodega, aún cuando se siente cansada, sin embargo, sabe que es su trabajo y que tiene que hacerlo, espera que más adelante su negocio crezca y le brinde mejores ingresos económicos.

Este es su crédito número 14 con MFP, está muy contenta de saber que desde que supo de esta microfinanciera, hace más de 5 años tiene un apoyo financiero. Por eso se compromete, una vez más, en cumplir con el pago puntual de sus cuotas como lo hizo en sus anteriores créditos. Además está muy contenta de pertenecer a su banco comunal, ya que todos sus integrantes son muy responsables y solidarios.

Con el monto solicitado (S/. 2000) comprará mayor cantidad de productos con los que implementará su tienda de abarrotes.
texts.en:
Rosa is 43 years old.  She is a kind, responsible, and hardworking woman.  She married 41-year-old Humberto 18 years ago and together they have four children who are still their dependents.  Their ages are 18, 15, 12, and 7.  She lives in the home she was able to build with her husband thanks to the effort they each put into their work.

She has a business selling groceries.  Every day, starting very early, she opens her store doors to serve all the customers who come to her business looking for products, knowing that they will find what they need.  Her store is the best stocked in the neighborhood and, in addition to that, her customers do not hesitate to buy from her because of the quality brands she offers and her wonderful customer service.  She remembers that when she started this business she did not have many products to offer and so she was not able to make good sales during the day.  This often discouraged her, but she nevertheless sought a solution; she saved up a small amount of capital and, little by little, she stocked her small store.  Now her sales are very good and 15 years of hard work have passed since then.  What she likes most about her work is sharing happy moments with her customers, talking with them, and seeing them start their days with a smile.  She finds that the hardest part is having to get up early to work in her store, but even when she feels tired, she knows that it is her job and she has to do it.  She hopes that her business will grow in the future and make her better income.

This is her 14th loan with MFP and she is very happy to know that since she discovered this microfinancier five years ago she has had financial support.  That is why she promises, once again, to make her payments on time, as she has with her previous loans.  She is also very happy to belong to her communal bank, as all of its members are very responsible and supportive. 

She will use the requested 2,000 nuevos soles to buy a greater variety of products with which she will stock her grocery store.

loans.use: to purchase rice, sugar, milk, etc. to stock her grocery store

loans.name: Katya Carolina

texts.es:
La Srta. Katya Carolina de 21 años de edad soltera, ella vive con su mama dado a que su papa falleció hace pocos meses, por lo cual ella ha asumido el rol de cabeza de familia. 
Katya cuenta con una antigüedad de 3 años en su empleo, es responsable por ello ha podido sacar adelante a su familia, en ocasiones su mama la apoya vendiendo ropa de segunda mano pero el empleo de Katya es el principal ingreso de la familia.
Ante esta situación ella se hace responsable de cuidar a su mama y procurar que nada les falte. Solicita de nuestra ayuda para empezar a construir una barda frente a su casa además de pagar mano de obra. Con esto podrá brindar una mejor seguridad a su familia.
texts.en:
Katya Carolina, 21, is single living with her mother because her father died a few months ago and she’s taken on the role of head of family.

Katya has three years’ experience in her job.  She’s responsible which is why she’s been able to move her family forward.  Sometimes her mother helps her selling second-hand clothes but Katya’s job is the family’s main source of income.

In face of this situation, she assumes the responsibility of caring for her mother and seeing that they lack nothing.  She’s asking our help to start building a wall in front of her house and also to pay labor costs for the project.  With this she will offer better security for her family.

loans.use: to build a front wall.

loans.name: Camino Al Progreso  (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal El Camino al Progreso está formado por 12 socias, quienes viven en diferentes sectores de la parroquia Turi en Cuenca, esta parroquia es conocida como la Merced de Turi, se encuentra al sureste de la ciudad, es muy visitada ya que desde allí se puede observar gran parte de la ciudad de Cuenca, también es conocida como el Balcón Cuencano. Su gente al igual que nuestras socias son personas amables, gentiles, se dedican a la cría de animales, agricultura y comercio, muchos salen diariamente a la ciudad a ejercer en diferentes plazas de trabajo, aun mantienen la cultura y tradiciones que sus padres les han inculcado.

Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora. María Eloisa, tiene 34 años, es casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 3 hijos de 14, 11 y 3 años de edad, su primera hija estudia en el colegio y su segunda hija en una escuelita de la localidad. Su esposo es pintor de profesión, la casa en la que viven es de su propiedad.

Doña María Eloisa se dedica a los quehaceres de su hogar y como vive en el campo trabaja en la agricultura, siembra hortalizas y verduras las mismas que son para el consumo de su hogar y para la venta, también cría y vende cerdos y pollos, estas actividades las realiza hace varios años.
 
Este es el segundo crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y lo va a invertir comprando alimento para animales y cerdos.
 
Sus metas son crecer en la cría de cerdos y  tener un granja.
texts.en:
The “El Camino al Progreso” (The Road to Progress) communal bank has 12 members who live in different parts of Turi Parish in Cuenca.  This parish is known as “La Merced de Turi” and is located in the southeast of the city.  It is very popular because a great part of the city of Cuenca can be observed from there.  It’s also knows as “El Balcón Cuencano” [The Cuenca Balcony].  Its residents, like our members, are nice, kind people who raise animals, farm and are merchants.  Many go out daily to work in various jobs in the city.  They preserve the culture and traditions their parents have instilled in them.

One of the members of this group is María Eloisa, 34.  She’s married and has had three children who are 14, 11 and 3 years of age.  Her oldest daughter attends secondary school and her second daughter the little local elementary school.  Her husband’s a painter by profession and the house they live in is theirs.

María Eloisa does her household chores but since they live in the countryside she works in agriculture.  She plants vegetables and greens both for home consumption and to sell; she also raises pigs and chickens, activities she’s been doing for several years.

This is the second loan she’s taken with the communal bank and she will use it to buy animal and pig feed.  Her goals are to grow as a pig farmer and to own a farm.

loans.use: to buy animal and pig feed.

loans.name: Gualaceñitas  (Gualeceo) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Las Gualaceñitas está formado por 14 socias quienes viven en el cantón Gualaceo, cantón que es conocido como el Jardín del Azuay por sus tierras aptas para la agricultura y su clima templado, también se dedican a la cría de animales y comercio. Su gente es amable, gentil y trabajadora como nuestras socias, sus hábiles manos elaboran el más fino calzado y otras artesanías, aun mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos.

Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora. Mariana de Jesús, tiene 53 años, es casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 11 hijos, 2 de sus hijos son casados, 4 trabajan y estudian a distancia, 1 estudia en el colegio y 4 trabajan y ayudan económicamente. Su esposo labora en la agricultura, la casa en la que viven es de su propiedad.

Doña Mariana de Jesús se dedica a la agricultura, siembra y vende hortalizas y también cría cerdos y pollos, también se dedica el bordado hace 24 años y esta actividad la aprendió trabajando, labora de lunes a viernes sin un horario ya que labora desde su casa.

Es socia del banco comunal hace un año y su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la  compra cerdos.
 
Su sueño es que sus hijos se superen y lleguen a ser buenos profesionales.

Las dos fotos pequeñas son de tres socias que no pudieron estar presentes cuando se tomo la foto del grupo.
texts.en:
The Las Gualaceñitas communal bank is made up of 14 members who live in the canton of Gualaceo. This canton is known as the garden of Azuay because of its suitable land and template climate. They also raise animals and have commerce there. Its people are kind, polite and hardworking, like our members. Their able hands make the finest shoes and other artisanal crafts. They still maintain the culture and traditions of their people.

One of the members of this group is Mariana de Jesús. She is  53, married and the mother of 11 children. Two of her children are married, four work and study elsewhere, 1 is in high school and 4 work and help out financially.  Her husband is a farmer, and they own the house they live in.

Mariana de Jesús is a farmer. She grows and sells vegetables. She also raises pigs and chickens and embroiders. She has embroidered for 24 years and learned the activity on the job. She works Mondays through Fridays with no set schedule, because she works at home. 

She has been a member of the communal bank for a year and will invest the new loan in buying pigs. 
 
Her dream is for her children to get ahead and have good jobs.

The two small photos are of three members who weren't able to be present when the group photo was taken.

loans.use: to buy pigs.

loans.name: Ofelia

texts.es:
La Sra. Ofelia de 44 años de edad es casada y con una hija, se dedica junto con su esposo a la venta de tacos y gorditas desde hace 5 años. Atreves de esto ha podido sacar adelante a su hija, además de darle un claro ejemplo de que con trabajo y esfuerzo todo es posible. 
Anteriormente también contaba con una tienda de abarrotes la cual tuvo que cerrar ya que amplio un cuarto en planta baja para hacer más grande el negocio el cual restaurara en unos meses, ahora ella solicita de nuestra ayuda para pagar la compostura de su automóvil, el cual utiliza los siete días de la semana para trasladarse a vender a otro punto de la ciudad y a realizar las compras de mercancía, por el momento ella tiene que trasladarse en carros de sitio y esto le ha generado gastos innecesarios pero tiene que hacerlos para seguir vendiendo y surtir  su negocio.
Ofelia agradecerá la ayuda brindada. Esperando que el crédito le ayude a mejorar su economía cada vez mas.
texts.en:
Ofelia, who is 44 years old, is married and has one daughter, has made a living for the past five years, together with her husband, on the sale of tacos and gorditas.   Through this she has been able to help her daughter to get ahead as well as give her a clear example of everything that is possible with work and effort.  Previously, she could also count on a grocery store which she had to close to expand a room on the ground floor to make the business larger and which will be restored in a few months.

Now, she is applying for our help to pay for the repair of her automobile, which she uses seven days a week to go to sell elsewhere in the city and to conduct the purchase of merchandise.  For the time being she has to go in taxis and this has created unnecessary expenses for her but she has to do it in order to keep selling and stocking her business.  Ofelia is grateful for the assistance provided to her.  She hopes that the loan with help her to increasingly improve her finances.

loans.use: to repair her automobile.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase mechanical farming equipment.

loans.name: La Florida  (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal La Florida está formado por 6 socias y 2 socios quienes viven en diferentes lugares de la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad conocida como la Santa Ana de los 4 ríos, desde Diciembre de 1999 es Patrimonio Cultural de la Humanidad, tiene una geografía accidentada, cuenta con diferentes lugares para disfrutar de la naturaleza. Su gente al igual que todas nuestras socias aun mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos, son personas amables, gentiles y muy trabajadoras. 

Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora. María Lastenia, tiene 44 años, es casada y fruto de su unión conyugal ha concebido 4 hijos de 19, 18, 15 y 10 años de edad, su primera hija es casada y vive independiente, su segundo hijo estudia en la universidad, su tercer hijo en el colegio y su último hijo estudia en una escuelita de la ciudad. Su esposo es de profesión chofer y presta sus servicios a una empresa privada, la casa en la que viven es de su propiedad.

Doña María Lastenia se dedica a los quehaceres de su hogar, pero hace 6 meses también se dedica a la venta de ropa, esta actividad la realiza recorriendo la ciudad y también vende a sus amigos y familiares.
 
Este es el tercer crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y lo va a invertir en la compra de ropa para surtir su mercadería. 

Su sueño es tener un local o una boutique para vender su mercadería.
texts.en:
The La Florida communal bank is comprised of six women and two men who live in different parts of the city of Cuenca.  This city is known as the Santa Ana of the Four Rivers.   In December 1999 it was named a Cultural World Heritage Site.  Cuenca has a varied geography, which provides beautiful landscapes to enjoy nature.  Its people, like all of our members, still maintain the culture and traditions of their pueblos.  They are kind, gracious, and very hard-working. 

María Lastenia, age 44, is one of the members of this group.  She is married, and they have four children, ages 19, 18, 15, and 10.  Her first daughter is married and lives independently.  Her second child attends the university.  Her third child goes to high school, and her last child goes to a city school.  Her husband is a driver for a private company.  The house they live in belongs to them.

María Lastenia devotes herself to the household chores.  She has also been selling clothes for six months.  She does this by going from place to place in the city, and she also sells to her friends and family members.

This is her third loan with her communal bank.  She will use it to buy clothes to stock her merchandise.

Her dream is to have a place or a boutique where she can sell her merchandise.

loans.use: to buy clothes.

loans.name: Svetlana

texts.ru:
Светлана использовала предыдущий кредит для увеличения торгового оборота, благодаря чему она получила дополнительную прибыль и смогла лучше позаботиться о своей семье.

В этот раз Светлана просит предоставить ей кредит в размере 20,000 гривен для закупки летнего товара - женских легких платьев, сарафанов, футболок, пр. Светлана прекрасно разбирается в женской одежде и всегда замечательно обслуживает своих клиентов. Это является залогом успеха ее бизнеса. Светлана мечтает открыть небольшой собственный магазин по продаже женской одежды.

Светлана занимается спортом и поддерживает прекрасную физическую форму. Это помогает ей как в личной жизни, так и в бизнесе.
texts.en:
Svetlana used her prior loan to increase her product inventory, thanks to which she earned extra profits and was able to take better care of her family.

This time Svetlana is asking for a loan of 20,000 Hryvnia to purchase summer products - light women's dresses, sleeveless dresses, tshirts, etc.  Svetlana is well versed in women's clothing and always serves her customers remarkably.  This is the key to the success of her business.  Svetlana dreams of opening a small store of her own that sells women's clothing.  

Svetlana exercises and is in excellent physical shape.  This helps her in her personal life and in her business.

loans.use: to purchase seasonal products - dresses and tshirts

loans.name: Nanuli

texts.en:
Nanuli is 29 years old. She is married and lives in a small village of Sagarejo district with her family: her husband Shalva and their 7-year-old daughter, who studies in the village school. Shalva works as a private security guard and gets a salary. Nanuli has a milking cow; she milks it twice in a day and sells the milk in nearby villages. She also has a vineyard; she and Shalva produce wine in the autumn. They sell grapes and wine on the local market. The family's average monthly income is 700 Lari. 

Nanuli requested a loan for purchasing three calves. She wants to raise them.  After they are grown, Nanuli will be able to increase cheese production. She will sell more milk and cheese, and the family will get additional income. With increased income, she will be able to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase three calves

loans.name: Rusudan

texts.en:
Rusudan is 60-year-old woman from the village of Gurjaani in East Georgia. She is a widow and lives with her mother-in-law, who is a pensioner. 

Rusudan is busy with agricultural business. She has a plot of land where she grows peaches. She works hard on her plot to get a good harvest. She sells her peaches on the local market. In addition to her agricultural business, she is busy with trading. She buys second-hand cloth in Tbilisi (capital of Georgia) and sells it from her house. She has a lot of customers and sells the goods for a good price. The family's average monthly income is 400 Lari.

Rusudan requested a loan to pay for her granddaughter's studies. With this loan, her granddaughter will be able to graduate from her institute. After graduation, she will start work and will be able to help the family. As a result, living conditions of the family will be improved.

loans.use: to finance her granddaughter's studies.

loans.name: Esdras

texts.en:
Esdras is married with five children. His wife is also a maize farmer. He has been a maize farmer for six years. He would like to get this loan to buy more seeds and support his labor to get the best harvest. With the profits, he wants to renovate his house.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more seeds and support labor costs

loans.name: Jane

texts.en: Jane is a 41-year-old single woman. She has 4 children with ages ranging from 5 years to 26 years. She describes herself to be social and jovial. She operates a store where she provides tailoring services. She has been involved in this business for 4 years. Her business is located along a busy road within an urban area, and her primary customers are residents within the area. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving her business. She will use the Kes 5,800 loan to buy a solar lantern for lighting in her house. Her business goal is to run a boutique. She plans to make sure that her children are all educated by paying for their school fees, as she is the sole provider of her family.

loans.use: To buy a solar lantern for her family

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en: Mariam, 26 years old, is married to a businessman. She has 2 children, 6 and 3, both attending school. Mariam sells fish in one of the busy streets in their trading center. She buys her stock from a regular fish monger who sometimes lets her buy on credit. Currently, Mariam's main problem is lack of enough capital to expand her business. She also says that since she lacks a refrigerator, her fish at times go bad. Mariam is requesting this first loan with Yehu in order to buy cooking oil, more fish and firewood. She wants to invest in her business. In the coming years, Mariam would like to have a small shop. She intends to use her profits to help her husband with the children's education.

loans.use: to buy cooking oil, fish and firewood.

loans.name: Mesalimu

texts.en:
Mesalimu is a 42-year-old woman. She is married and a mother to seven children, four of whom are in school, while the rest are married. Her husband is a fish monger, and they live in their own house. He gets a low income, which is not enough to cover the family's needs and pay for their children's educational expenses.

For the past two years, Mesalimu has been selling cereals in a small store. She wants to live in better conditions with her family, so she is requesting a 20,000 Kenyan Shillings loan from Yehu to help her purchase sacks of maize and beans.
 
Mesalimu hopes to educate her children so they can become professionals.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of maize and beans

loans.name: Madona

texts.en:
Madona is 29 years old. She is married and lives in a small village of Gurjaani District with her family: her husband David, her parents-in-law, and her two children (2 and 4 years old). 

The family members are busy with agricultural business. They have two milking cows and two calves. They produce cheese, some of which is for the family and the rest is sold locally. The family also owns a vineyard; they harvest grapes and sell them on the local market. Along with the agricultural business, Madona is busy with trading. She buys clothes in Tbilisi (capital of Georgia) and sells them in her village. The family's average monthly income is 800 Lari. 

Madona requested a loan to buy additional clothing. She will diversify the assortment that she has for sale and attract new customers. Her sales will increase, and the profit will increase the family's monthly income. As a result, Madona will be able to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase clothing for resale and diversify her inventory.
